member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.AllowCustomPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether custom paging should be performed instead of the integrated automatic paging.

remarks.para: This online example demonstrates an approach to implementing custom paging with Telerik RadGrid. The simulated "DataLayer" wraps the logic of extracting records for only the specified page and deleting records. Telerik RadGrid maintains the pager buttons, changing of pager and other presentation specific features.
Another available option for custom paging support is represented in the how-to section.

Note: There is no universal mechanism for grouping when custom paging is allowed. The reason for this is that with the custom paging mechanism you fetch only part of the whole information from the grid datasource. Thus, when you trigger the grouping event the grid is restricted from operating with the whole available source data and is not able to group the items accurately. Furthermore, the aggregate functions as Count, Sum, etc. (covering operations with the whole set of grid items) will return incorrect results.

A workaround solution for you could be to use hierarchy in the grid instead of grouping to single out the grid items logically and visually according to custom criteria. Thus you will be able to use custom paging without further limitations.

Another approach is to build your own complex SQL statements which to get the whole available data from the grid datasource and then group the items in the grid with custom code logic.
Finally, you can use standard paging instead of custom paging to ensure the consistency of the data on grouping.

member.value: true, if custom paging is allowed; otherwise false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.AllowPaging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the automatic paging feature is enabled.
member.value: true if the paging feature is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is false

remarks.para: Instead of displaying all the records in the data source at the same time, the Telerik RadGrid control can automatically break the records up into pages. If the data source supports the paging capability, the Telerik RadGrid control can take advantage of that and provide built-in paging functionality. The paging feature can be used with any data source object that supports the System.Collections.ICollection interface or a data source that supports paging capability.

To enable the paging feature, set the AllowPaging property to true. By default, the Telerik RadGrid control displays 10 records on a page at a time. You can change the number of records displayed on a page by setting the PageSize property. To determine the total number of pages required to display the data source contents, use the PageCount property. You can determine the index of the currently displayed page by using the CurrentPageIndex property.

When paging is enabled, an additional item called the pager item is automatically displayed in the Telerik RadGrid control. The pager item contains controls that allow the user to navigate to the other pages. You can control the settings of the pager item by using the PagerItemStyle property. The pager item can be displayed at the top, bottom, or both the top and bottom of the control by setting the Position property. You can also select from one of four built-in pager display modes by setting the Mode property.
The Telerik RadGrid control also allows you to define a custom template for the pager item.

member.example:
The following code example demonstrates how to use the AllowPaging property to declaratively enable the paging feature in the Telerik RadGrid control. <%@ Page Language="VB" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" TagPrefix="telerik" %> Untitled Page
$ ConnectionStrings>" SelectCommand="SELECT [CustomerID], [ContactName], [CompanyName] FROM [Customers]">

requirements.para: Supported in: 3.0, 2.0, 1.1, 1.0 .NET Framework

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.AllowSorting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the sorting feature is enabled.
member.value: true if the sorting feature is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is false.

remarks.para: When a data source control that supports sorting is bound to the Telerik RadGrid control, the Telerik RadGrid control can take advantage of the data source control's capabilities and provide automatic sorting functionality.
To enable sorting, set the AllowSorting property to true. When sorting is enabled, the heading text for each column field with its SortExpression property set is displayed as a link button.

Clicking the link button for a column causes the items in the Telerik RadGrid control to be sorted based on the sort expression. Typically, the sort expression is simply the name of the field displayed in the column, which causes the Telerik RadGrid control to sort with respect to that column. To sort by multiple fields, use a sort expression that contains a comma-separated list of field names. You can determine the sort expression that the Telerik RadGrid control is applying by using the SortExpression property. Clicking a column's link button repeatedly toggles the sort direction between ascending and descending order.

requirements.para: Supported in: 3.0, 2.0, 1.1, 1.0 .NET Framework

member.example: The following code example demonstrates how to use the AllowSorting property to enable sorting in a Telerik RadGrid control when automatically generated columns are used. <%@ Page Language="VB" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" TagPrefix="telerik" %> Untitled Page

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether bound fields are automatically created for each field in the data source.

remarks.para: When the AutoGenerateColumns property is set to true, an GridBoundColumn object is automatically created for each field in the data source. Each field is then displayed as a column in the Telerik RadGrid control in the order that the fields appear in the data source. This option provides a convenient way to display every field in the data source; however, you have limited control of how an automatically generated column field is displayed or behaves.
This set of columns can be accessed using the AutoGeneratedColumns collection.

item.description: Runtime auto-generated columns will always appear after the user-specified columns, unless the columns are ordered programmatically.

remarks.para: Instead of letting the Telerik RadGrid control automatically generate the column fields, you can manually define the column fields by setting the AutoGenerateColumns property to false and then creating a custom Columns collection. In addition to bound column fields, you can also display a button column, a check box column, a button column, a hyperlink column, an image column, or a column based on your own custom-defined template etc.

member.value: true to automatically create bound fields for each field in the data source; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.example:
The following code example demonstrates how to use the AutoGenerateColumns property to automatically create bound columns in a Telerik RadGrid control for each field in the data source. <%@ Page Language="VB" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" TagPrefix="telerik" %> Untitled Page
$ ConnectionStrings>" SelectCommand="SELECT [CustomerID], [ContactName], [CompanyName] FROM [Customers]">

remarks.para: Use the BackImageUrl property to specify the URL to an image to display in the background of a Telerik RadGrid control.
If the specified image is smaller than the Telerik RadGrid control, the image is tiled to fill in the background. If the image is larger than the control, the image is cropped.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.MasterTableView
member.summary: The instance of that represents the main grid-table view in RadGrid.

remarks.para: Telerik RadGrid introduces a new approach to hierarchical data structures. The innovative in Telerik RadGrid is having a so called MasterTableView. This is the topmost table of the hierarchical structure. It is a with . The collection holds the so called DetailTables - tables related to the fields of the MasterTable. Each DetailTable can have its own GridTableViewCollection with other Detail Tables, thus forming the hierarchical structure.

item.description: Note: There is only one Master Table for a single Telerik RadGrid. This is the topmost table. All inner tables are referred as a Detail Tables regardless of whether they have related (inner) tables or not.

member.value: A reference to the topmost , i.e the MasterTableView.

example.pre:
<radg:radgrid id="RadGrid1" runat="server"
CssClass= "RadGrid" Width="100%" AutoGenerateColumns="False" PageSize="3" AllowSorting="True"
AllowMultiRowSelection= "False" AllowPaging="True" GridLines="None" AllowFilteringByColumn="true">
<PagerStyle Mode="NumericPages" CssClass="Pager"></PagerStyle>
<HeaderStyle CssClass="Header"></HeaderStyle>
<ItemStyle CssClass="Row"></ItemStyle>
<AlternatingItemStyle CssClass="AltRow"></AlternatingItemStyle>
<MasterTableView DataKeyNames="CustomerID" AllowMultiColumnSorting="True">
<DetailTables>
<radG:GridTableView DataKeyNames="OrderID" DataMember="Orders">
<ParentTableRelation>
<radG:GridRelationFields DetailKeyField="CustomerID" MasterKeyField="CustomerID" />
</ParentTableRelation>
<DetailTables>
<radG:GridTableView DataKeyNames="OrderID" DataMember="OrderDetails">
<ParentTableRelation>
<radG:GridRelationFields DetailKeyField="OrderID" MasterKeyField="OrderID" />
</ParentTableRelation>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.CurrentPageIndex

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.EditItemStyle
member.summary: Gets a reference to the GridTableItemStyle object that allows you to set the appearance of the item selected for editing in a Telerik RadGrid control.
member.value: A reference to the GridTableItemStyle that represents the style of the item being edited in a Telerik RadGrid control.

requirements.para: Supported in: 3.0, 2.0, 1.1, 1.0 .NET Framework

remarks.para: Use the EditItemStyle property to control the appearance of the item being edited in a Telerik RadGrid control. This property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the GridTableItemStyle object it returns. The properties can be set declaratively using one of the following methods:

list.item: Place an attribute in the opening tag of the Telerik RadGrid control in the form Property-Subproperty, where Subproperty is a property of the GridTableItemStyle object (for example, EditItemStyle-ForeColor).
Nest a <EditItemStyle> element between the opening and closing tags of the Telerik RadGrid control.

remarks.para: The properties can also be set programmatically in the form Property.Subproperty (for example, EditItemStyle.ForeColor). Common settings usually include a custom background color, foreground color, and font properties.

member.example: The following code example demonstrates how to use the EditItemStyle property to define a custom style for the item being edited in a Telerik RadGrid control. <%@ Page Language="VB" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" TagPrefix="telerik" %> Untitled Page

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.Items
member.summary: Gets a collection of all GridDataItems.

remarks.para: The RadGrid control automatically populates the Items collection by creating a GridDataItem object for each record in the data source and then adding each object to the collection. This property is commonly used to access a specific item in the control or to iterate though the entire collection of items.
You cannot use this collection to get special Items like Header, Pager, Footer, etc. Handle event and use the event arguments to get a reference to such items.

member.value: all grid data items as

member.remarks: Use the ItemStyle property to control the appearance of the data items in a Telerik RadGrid control. member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.PageCount

summary.para: Gets the number of pages required to display the records of the data source in a Telerik RadGrid control.

member.remarks: When the paging feature is enabled (by setting the AllowPaging property to true), use the PageCount property to determine the total number of pages required to display the records in the data source. This value is calculated by dividing the total number of records in the data source by the number of records displayed in a page (as specified by the PageSize property) and rounding up.
member.value: The number of pages in a Telerik RadGrid control.
member.example:
The following code example demonstrates how to use the PageCount property to determine the total number of pages displayed in the Telerik RadGrid control. <%@ Page Language="C#" %> <%@ Register Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" TagPrefix="telerik" %> Untitled Page
<%@ Page Language="VB" @ Register Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" TagPrefix="telerik" %> Untitled Page

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.PagerStyle
member.summary: Gets a reference to the GridPagerStyle object that allows you to set the appearance of the page item in a Telerik RadGrid control.
member.value: A GridPagerStyle object that contains the style properties of the paging section of the RadGrid control. The default value is an empty GridPagerStyle object.

remarks.para: Use this property to provide a custom style for the paging section of the RadGrid control. Common style attributes that can be adjusted include forecolor, backcolor, font, and content alignment within the cell. Providing a different style enhances the appearance of the RadGrid control.

To specify a custom style for the paging section, place the <PagerStyle> tags between the opening and closing tags of the RadGrid control. You can then list the style attributes within the opening <PagerStyle> tag.

member.example:
The following code example demonstrates how to use the PagerStyle property to specify a custom style for the page selection elements of the RadGrid control. <%@ Page Language="VB" %> <%@ Import Namespace="System.Data" @ Register TagPrefix="telerik" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" %> RadGrid Paging Example

RadGrid Paging Example
<%@ Page Language="C#" %> <%@ Import Namespace="System.Data" @ Register TagPrefix="telerik" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" %> RadGrid Paging Example

RadGrid Paging Example

requirements.para: Supported in: 3.0, 2.0, 1.1, 1.0 .NET Framework

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadGrid.VirtualItemCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, indicating the total number of items in the data source when custom paging is used. Thus the grid "understands" that the data source contains the specified number of records and it should fetch merely part of them at a time to execute requested operation.
member.value: int, representing the total number of items in the datasource. The default value is 0.

remarks.para: If you set a value that is greater than the actual number of items, RadGrid will show all available items plus empty pages (or whatever other content you set) for the items that exceed the actual number.

For example you have a data source with 9'000 items and you set VirtualItemCount to 10'000. If your page size is 1000, the grid will render 10 pages and the last page will be empty (or with NoRecordsTemplate if you're using such).

< radG:RadGrid ID="RadGrid1" DataSourceID="AccessDataSource1" AllowPaging="True" ShowFooter="True" runat="server" AutoGenerateColumns="False" AllowSorting="True" PageSize="3" Width="925px" GridLines="None" CellPadding="0" Skin="Default" AllowMultiRowSelection="true"> Template footer

Search Google for <%#Eval("ContactName") %>

code.title: Create column in the code-behind

code.title: Create column in the code-behind
code.description: The following example demonstrates how to set up a grid in the code-behind and how to create a column and add it to the Columns collection.

example.code:
Me.RadGrid1 = New RadGrid
AddHandler RadGrid1.NeedDataSource, AddressOf Me.RadGrid1_NeedDataSource AddHandler RadGrid1.DetailTableDataBind, AddressOf Me.RadGrid1_DetailTableDataBind
Me.RadGrid1.AutoGenerateColumns = False Me.RadGrid1.MasterTableView.DataMember = "Customers"
Dim boundColumn As GridBoundColumn boundColumn = New GridBoundColumn boundColumn.DataField = "CustomerID" boundColumn.HeaderText = "CustomerID" Me.RadGrid1.MasterTableView.Columns.Add(boundColumn)
....'Add to page controls collection Me.PlaceHolder1.Controls.Add(RadGrid1)

This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.

member.example:
The following code example demonstrates how the DataSourceID property of a Telerik RadGrid control is used. The Telerik RadGrid control is associated to the SqlDataSource control by setting its DataSourceID property to "SqlDataSource1", the ID of the SqlDataSource control. When the DataSourceID property is set (instead of the DataSource property), the Telerik RadGrid control automatically binds to the data source control at run time. <%@ Page Language="VB" @ Register Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" TagPrefix="telerik" %> Untitled Page

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.ExpandDirection
member.summary: This enumeration determines the direction in which child items will open.

remarks.para: When set to Auto the direction is determined by the following rules

list.item: If the item is top level and the parent item flow is Horizontal the direction will be Down.
If the item is top level and the parent item flow is Vertical the direction will be Right.
If the item is subitem (a child of another menu item rather than the RadMenu itself) the direction is Right.

remarks.para: Note:
If there is not enough room for the child items to open the expand direction is inverted. For example Right becomes Left, Down becomes Up and vice versa.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.ExpandDirection.Auto
member.summary: The direction is determined by parent's ItemFlow and level.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.ExpandDirection.Up
member.summary: Child items open above their parent.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.ExpandDirection.Down
member.summary: Child items open below their parent.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.ExpandDirection.Left
member.summary: Child items open from the left side of their parent.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.ExpandDirection.Right
member.summary: Child items open from the right side of their parent.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.ItemFlow
member.summary: Represents the different ways menu items can flow.
member.remarks: The ItemFlow enumeration is used to specify the flow of submenu items.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.ItemFlow.Vertical
member.summary: Items will flow one below the other

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.ItemFlow.Horizontal
member.summary: Items will flow one after another

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem
member.summary: Represents an item in the control.

remarks.para: The control is made up of items. Items which are immediate children of the menu are root items. Items which are children of root items are child items.
An item usually stores data in two properties, the property and the property. The value of the property is displayed in the control, and the property is used to store additional data.
To create items, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to define items inline in your page or user control.
Use one of the constructors to dynamically create new instances of the class. These items can then be added to the Items collection of another item or menu.
Data bind the control to a data source.

remarks.para: When the user clicks an item, the control can navigate to a linked Web page, post back to the server or select that item. If the property of an item is set, the RadMenu control navigates to the linked page. By default, a linked page is displayed in the same window or frame. To display the linked content in a different window or frame, use the property.

member.summary: Represents a single item in the RadMenu class.

remarks.para: The RadMenu control is made up of a hierarchy of menu items represented by RadMenuItem objects. Menu items at the top level (level 0) that do not have a parent menu item are called root or top-level menu items. A menu item that has a parent menu item is called a submenu item. All root menu items are stored in the Items collection of the menu. Submenu items are stored in a parent menu item's Items collection. You can access a menu item's parent menu item by using the Owner property.
To create the menu items for a RadMenu control, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to create static menu items.
Use a constructor to dynamically create new instances of the RadMenuItem class. These RadMenuItem objects can then be added to the Items collection of their owner.
Bind the Menu control to a data source.

remarks.para: When the user clicks a menu item, the Menu control can either navigate to a linked Web page or simply post back to the server. If the NavigateUrl property of a menu item is set, the RadMenu control navigates to the linked page. By default, a linked page is displayed in the same window or frame as the RadMenu control. To display the linked content in a different window or frame, use the Target property.
Each menu item has a Text and a Value property. The value of the Text property is displayed in the RadMenu control, while the Value property is used to store any additional data about the menu item.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.HighlightPath
member.summary: Highlights the path from the item to the top of the menu.
member.remarks: The HighlightPath method applies the "rmFocused" CSS class to the item and his ancestor items. As a results the "path" from the top level to that specific item is highlighted.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.Clone
member.summary: Creates a copy of the current RadMenuItem object.
member.returns: A RadMenuItem which is a copy of the current one.
member.remarks: Use the Clone method to create a copy of the current item. All properties of the clone are set to the same values as the current ones. Child items are not cloned.

The url which the item will navigate to. The NavigateUrl property is set to the value of this parameter.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.Items
member.summary: Gets a object that contains the child items of the current RadMenuItem.
member.value: A that contains the child items of the current RadMenuItem. By default the collection is empty (the item has no children).
member.remarks: Use the Items property to access the child items of the RadMenuItem. You can also use the Items property to manage the child items - you can add, remove or modify items.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.Owner
member.summary: Gets the object which contains the current menu item.
member.value: The object which contains the menu item. It might be an instance of the class or the class depending on the hierarchy level.
member.remarks: The value is of the type which is implemented by the and the classes. Use the Owner property when recursively traversing items in the RadMenu control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.DataItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the data item represented by the item.
member.value: An object representing the data item to which the Item is bound to. The DataItem property will always return null when accessed outside of MenuItemDataBound event handler.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only during data binding. Use it along with the MenuItemDataBound event to perform additional mapping of fields from the data item to RadMenuItem properties.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text caption for the menu item.
member.value: The text of the item. The default value is empty string.
member.example:
This example demonstrates how to set the text of the item using the Text property.
<telerik:RadMenu ID="RadMenu1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadMenuItem Text="News" />
<telerik:RadMenuItem Text="News" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadMenu>
member.remarks: Use the Text property to specify the text to display for the item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the menu item.
member.value: The value associated with the item. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the Value property to specify or determine the value associated with the item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.ItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the item.

value.para: A ITemplate implemented object that contains the template for displaying the item. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.
To specify common display for all menu items use the ItemTemplate property of the RadMenu class.

example.para: The following template demonstrates how to add a Calendar control in certain menu item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.GroupSettings
member.summary: Specifies the settings for child item behavior.
member.value: An instance of the MenuItemGroupSettings class.

remarks.para: You can customize the following settings

list.item: item flow
expand direction
horizontal offset from the parent item
vertical offset from the parent item
width
height

remarks.para: For more information check MenuItemGroupSettings.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.ExpandMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the expand behavior of the menu item.
When set to ExpandMode.WebService the RadMenuItem will populate its children from the web service specified by the RadMenu.WebService and RadMenu.WebServiceMethod properties.
member.value: On of the MenuItemExpandMode values. The default value is ClientSide.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.NavigateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to link to when the item is clicked.
member.value: The URL to link to when the item is clicked. The default value is empty string.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the NavigateUrl property
<telerik:RadMenu id="RadMenu1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadMenuItem Text="News" NavigateUrl="~/News.aspx" />
<telerik:RadMenuItem Text="External URL" NavigateUrl="http://www.example.com" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadMenu>
member.remarks: Use the NavigateUrl property to specify the URL to link to when the item is clicked. Use "~" (tilde) in front of an URL within the same ASP.NET application. When specifying external URL do not forget the protocol (e.g. "http://").

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.PostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether clicking on the item will postback.
member.value: True if the menu item should postback; otherwise false. By default all the items will postback provided the user has subscribed to the ItemClick event.
member.remarks: If you subscribe to the ItemClick all menu items will postback. To turn off that behavior you should set the PostBack property to false. This property cannot be set in design time.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.Menu
member.summary: Gets the RadMenu instance which contains the item.
member.remarks: Use this property to obtain an instance to the RadMenu object containing the item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.IsSeparator
member.summary: Sets or gets whether the item is separator. It also represents a logical state of the item. Might be used in some applications for keyboard navigation to omit processing items that are marked as separators.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.DisabledCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the menu item is disabled.
member.value: The CSS class applied when the menu item is disabled. The default value is "disabled".
member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of disabled menu items is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the DisabledCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the menu item when it is disabled.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.ExpandedCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the menu item is opened (its child items are visible).
member.value: The CSS class applied when the menu item is opened. The default value is "expanded".
member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of opened menu items is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the ExpandedCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the menu item when it is opened.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.FocusedCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the menu item is focused.
member.value: The CSS class applied when the menu item is focused. The default value is "focused".
member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of focused menu items is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the FocusedCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the menu item when it is focused.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.ClickedCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the menu item is clicked.
member.value: The CSS class applied when the menu item is clicked. The default value is "clicked".
member.example: By default the visual appearance of clicked menu items is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the ClickedCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the menu item when it is clicked.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target window or frame to display the Web page content linked to when the menu item is clicked.
member.value:
The target window or frame to load the Web page linked to when the Item is selected. Values must begin with a letter in the range of a through z (case insensitive), except for the following special values, which begin with an underscore:
_blank Renders the content in a new window without frames.
_parent Renders the content in the immediate frameset parent.
_self Renders the content in the frame with focus.
_top Renders the content in the full window without frames.
The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the Target property to specify the frame or window that displays the Web page linked to when the menu item is clicked. The Web page is specified by setting the NavigateUrl property.
If this property is not set, the Web page specified by the NavigateUrl property is loaded in the current window.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to use the Target property

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.Level
member.summary: Manages the item level of a particular Item instance. This property allows easy implementation/separation of the menu items in levels.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to an image to display for the item.
member.value: The path to the image to display for the item. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the ImageUrl property to specify the image for the item. If the ImageUrl property is set to empty string no image will be rendered. Use "~" (tilde) when referring to images within the current ASP.NET application.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to specify the image to display for the item using the ImageUrl property.

para.para:
<telerik:RadMenu id="RadMenu1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadMenuItem ImageUrl="~/Img/inbox.gif" Text="Index" />
<telerik:RadMenuItem ImageUrl="~/Img/outbox.gif" Text="Outbox" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadMenu>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItem.HoveredImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to an image to display for the item when the user moves the mouse over the item.
member.value: The path to the image to display when the user moves the mouse over the item. The default value is empty string.

example.para:
<telerik:RadMenu id="RadMenu1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadMenuItem ImageUrl="~/Img/inbox.gif" HoveredImageUrl="~/Img/inboxOver.gif" Text="Index" />
<telerik:RadMenuItem ImageUrl="~/Img/outbox.gif" HoveredImageUrl="~/Img/outboxOver.gif" Text="Outbox" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadMenu>

member.remarks: Use the HoveredImageUrl property to specify the image that will be used when the user moves the mouse over the item. If the HoveredImageUrl property is set to empty string the image specified by the ImageUrl property will be used. Use "~" (tilde) when referring to images within the current ASP.NET application.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItemGroupSettings
member.summary: Represents settings controlling child item behavior.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItemGroupSettings.Flow
member.summary: Gets or sets the flow of child items.
member.value: One of the ItemFlow enumeration values. The default value is Vertical.
member.remarks: Use the Flow property to customize the flow of child menu items. By default RadMenu mimics the behavior of Windows and child items (apart from top level ones) flow vertically.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItemGroupSettings.ExpandDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which child items will open.
member.value: One of the ExpandDirection enumeration values. The default value is Auto.
member.remarks: Use the ExpandDirection property to specify different expand direction than the automatically determined one. See the ExpandDirection description for more information.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItemGroupSettings.OffsetX
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the horizontal offset of child menu items considering their parent.
member.value: An integer specifying the horizontal offset of child menu items (measured in pixels). The default value is 0 (no offset).

remarks.para: Use the OffsetX property to change the position where child items will appear.
To customize the vertical offset use the OffsetY property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItemGroupSettings.OffsetY
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the vertical offset of child menu items considering their parent.
member.value: An integer specifying the vertical offset of child menu items (measured in pixels). The default value is 0 (no offset).

remarks.para: Use the OffsetY property to change the position where child items will appear.
To customize the horizontal offset use the OffsetX property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItemGroupSettings.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the width of child menu items (the whole item group).
member.value: A Unit that represents the width of the child item group. The default value is Unit.Empty.
member.remarks: If the total width of menu items exceeds the Width property scrolling will be applied.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadMenuItemGroupSettings.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the height of child menu items (the whole item group).
member.value: A Unit that represents the height of the child item group. The default value is Unit.Empty.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadScriptManager
member.summary: ScriptManager derived class to add the ability to combine multiple smaller scripts into a larger one as a way to reduce the number of files the client must download

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadScriptManager.EnableHandlerDetection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if RadScriptManager should check the Telerik.Web.UI.WebResource handler existence in the application configuration file.
member.remarks: When EnableHandlerDetection set to true, RadScriptManager automatically checks if the HttpHandler it uses is registered to the application configuration file and throws an exception if the HttpHandler registration missing. Set this property to false if your scenario uses a file to output the combined scripts, or when running in Medium trust.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadScriptManager.EnableScriptCombine
member.summary: Specifies whether or not multiple script references should be combined into a single file
member.remarks: When EnableScriptCombine set to true, the script references of the controls on the page are combined to a single file, so that only one <script> tag is output to the page HTML

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadScriptManager.OutputCompression
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the combined output will be compressed.

remarks.para: In some cases the browsers do not recognize compressed streams (e.g. if IE 6 lacks an update installed). In some cases the Telerik.Web.UI.WebResource handler cannot determine if to compress the stream. Set this property to Disabled if you encounter that problem.
The OutputCompression property works only when EnableScriptCombine is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadScriptManager.HttpHandlerUrl
member.summary: Specifies the URL of the HTTPHandler that combines and serves the scripts.

remarks.para: The HTTPHandler should either be registered in the application configuration file, or a file with the specified name should exist at the location, which HttpHandlerUrl points to.
If a file is to serve the files, it should inherit the class Telerik.Web.UI.WebResource

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.SpellChecker.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new RadSpellChecker object. You need to pass a correct path to the folder that contains the dictionary files (*.TDF)
member.remarks:
The method expects local paths. E.g. "C:\SomeFolder\RadControls\Spell\TDF". Transform URL's to local paths with the method. C#
SpellChecker checker = new SpellChecker(Server.MapPath("~/RadControls/Spell/TDF"));
VB.NET
Dim checker As SpellChecker checker = New SpellChecker(Server.MapPath("~/RadControls/Spell/TDF"))

member.summary: Cleans up any resources held by the SpellChecker object. It is an alias of the Dispose method.

member.returns: -- a collection with all the errors found.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.SpellChecker.Dispose
member.summary: Clean up used resources.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.SpellChecker.Text
member.summary: Sets the text to be spellchecked. It can be plain text or HTML.
member.remarks:
This property can be used to pass the text to the spellchecker engine programmatically. The engine can deal with plaintext or any HTML-like format. It ignores text inside angle brackets (<>) and transforms HTML entities to their character values. E.g. & becomes & C#:
using (SpellChecker checker = new SpellChecker(Server.MapPath("~/RadControls/Spell/TDF"))) { checker.Text = text; return checker.Errors; }
VB.NET
Dim checker As SpellChecker Try checker = New SpellChecker(Server.MapPath("~/RadControls/Spell/TDF")) checker.Text = text Return checker.Errors Finally checker.Dispose() End Try

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.SpellChecker.DictionaryLanguage
member.summary: The language of the dictionary to be used for spellchecking. It usually is the same as the corresponding TDF file (without the extension).
member.remarks:
To spellcheck in German you have to have de-DE.tdf inside your dictionary folder, and set DictionaryLanguage to "de-DE" C#:
spellChecker.DictionaryLanguage = "de-DE";
VB.NET
spellChecker.DictionaryLanguage = "de-DE"
member.value: The default is en-US

SpellChecker checker = new SpellChecker(Server.MapPath("~/RadControls/Spell/TDF"));

Dim checker As SpellChecker checker = New SpellChecker(Server.MapPath("~/RadControls/Spell/TDF"))

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadStyleSheetManager.EnableHandlerDetection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if RadStyleSheetManager should check the Telerik.Web.UI.WebResource handler existence in the application configuration file.
member.remarks: When EnableHandlerDetection set to true, RadStyleSheetManager automatically checks if the HttpHandler it uses is registered to the application configuration file and throws an exception if the HttpHandler registration missing. Set this property to false if your scenario uses a file to output the combined skins, or when running in Medium trust.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadStyleSheetManager.EnableStyleSheetCombine
member.summary: Specifies whether or not multiple embedded stylesheet references should be combined into a single file
member.remarks: When EnableStyleSheetCombine set to true, the stylesheet references of the controls on the page are combined to a single file, so that only one <link> tag is output to the page HTML

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadStyleSheetManager.OutputCompression
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the combined output will be compressed.

remarks.para: In some cases the browsers do not recognize compressed streams (e.g. if IE 6 lacks an update installed). In some cases the Telerik.Web.UI.WebResource handler cannot determine if to compress the stream. Set this property to Disabled if you encounter that problem.
The OutputCompression property works only when EnableStyleSheetCombine is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadStyleSheetManager.HttpHandlerUrl

remarks.para: The HTTPHandler should either be registered in the application configuration file, or a file with the specified name should exist at the location, which HttpHandlerUrl points to.
If a file is to serve the files, it should inherit the class Telerik.Web.UI.WebResource

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode
member.summary: Represents a node in the RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: The RadTreeView control is made up of nodes. Nodes which are immediate children of the treeview are root nodes. Nodes which are children of root nodes are child nodes.

A node usually stores data in two properties, the Text property and the Value property. The value of the Text property is displayed in the RadTreeView control, and the Value property is used to store additional data.
To create tree nodes, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to define nodes inline in your page or user control.
Use one of the constructors to dynamically create new instances of the RadTreeNode class. These nodes can then be added to the Nodes collection of another node or treeview.
Data bind the RadTreeView control to a data source.

remarks.para: When the user clicks a tree node, the RadTreeView control can navigate to a linked Web page, post back to the server or select that node. If the NavigateUrl property of a node is set, the RadTreeView control navigates to the linked page. By default, a linked page is displayed in the same window or frame. To display the linked content in a different window or frame, use the Target property.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the node is enabled.
member.value: true if the node is enabled; otherwise false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Disabled nodes cannot be clicked, or expanded.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.Nodes
member.summary: Gets a object that contains the child nodes of the current RadTreeNode.
member.value: A that contains the child nodes of the current RadTreeNode. By default the collection is empty (the node has no children).
member.remarks: Use the Nodes property to access the child nodes of the RadTreeNode. You can also use the Nodes property to manage the child nodes - you can add, remove or modify nodes.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.DataItem
member.summary: Gets the data item that is bound to the node
member.value: An Object that represents the data item that is bound to the node. The default value is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that the node is not bound to any data item. The return value will always be null unless accessed within a NodeDataBound event handler.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only during data binding. Use it along with the NodeDataBound event to perform additional mapping of fields from the data item to RadTreeNode properties.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed for the current node.
member.value: The text displayed for the node in the RadTreeView control. The default is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the Text property to specify or determine the text that is displayed for the node in the RadTreeView control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets custom (user-defined) data associated with the current node.
member.value: A string representing the user-defined data. The default value is emptry string.
member.remarks: Use the Value property to associate custom data with a RadTreeNode object.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.NavigateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to navigate to when the current node is clicked.
member.value: The URL to navigate to when the node is clicked. The default value is empty string which means that clicking the current node will not navigate.

remarks.para: Setting the NavigateUrl property will disable node selection and as a result the NodeClick event won't be raised for the current node.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target window or frame in which to display the Web page content associated with the current node.
member.value:
The target window or frame to load the Web page linked to when the node is clicked. Values must begin with a letter in the range of a through z (case insensitive), except for the following special values, which begin with an underscore:
_blank Renders the content in a new window without frames.
_parent Renders the content in the immediate frameset parent.
_self Renders the content in the frame with focus.
_top Renders the content in the full window without frames.
The default value is empty string which means the linked resource will be loaded in the current window.

remarks.para: Use the Target property to target window or frame in which to display the Web page content associated with the current node. The Web page is specified by the NavigateUrl property.
If this property is not set, the Web page specified by the NavigateUrl property is loaded in the current window.
The Target property is taken into consideration only when the NavigateUrl property is set.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the Target property
<telerik:RadTreeView id="RadTreeView1" runat="server">
<Nodes>
<telerik:RadTreeNode Text="News" NavigateUrl="~/News.aspx" Target="_self" />
<telerik:RadTreeNode Text="External URL" NavigateUrl="http://www.example.com" Target="_blank" />
</Nodes>
</telerik:RadTreeView>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image which is displayed next to the text of a node.
member.value: The URL to the image to display for the node. The default value is empty string which means by default no image is displayed.
member.remarks: Use the ImageUrl property to specify a custom image that will be displayed before the text of the current node.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to specify the image to display for the node using the ImageUrl property.

<telerik:RadTreeView id="RadTreeView1" runat="server">
<Nodes>
<telerik:RadTreeNodeImageUrl="~/Img/inbox.gif" Text="Index"></telerik:RadTreeNode>
<telerik:RadTreeNodeImageUrl="~/Img/outbox.gif" Text="Outbox"></telerik:RadTreeNode>
<telerik:RadTreeNodeImageUrl="~/Img/trash.gif" Text="Trash"></telerik:RadTreeNode>
<telerik:RadTreeNodeImageUrl="~/Img/meetings.gif" Text="Meetings"></telerik:RadTreeNode>
</Nodes>
</telerik:RadTreeView>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets the category of the node.
member.remarks: The Category property is similar to the Value property. You can use it to associate custom data with the node.
member.example: This example illustrates how to use the Category property during the NodeDataBound event.
member.code: Protected Sub RadTreeView1_NodeDataBound(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As RadTreeNodeEventArgs) Handles RadTreeView1.NodeDataBound ' "NodeCategory" is the database column which provides data for the Category property. e.Node.Category = DataBinder.Eval(e.Node.DataItem, "NodeCategory") End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.HoveredCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied to the node when the mouse hovers it.
member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of hovered nodes is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the HoveredCssClass property to specify unique appearance for a node when it is hoevered.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.NodeTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the node.

value.para: An object implementing the ITemplate interface. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.
To specify common display for all nodes use the property of the control.

example.para: The following template demonstrates how to add a Calendar control in certain node.

<telerik: RadTreeView runat="server" ID="RadTreeView1"> <Nodes> <telerik:RadTreeNode Text="Root Node" Expanded="True" > <Nodes> <telerik:RadTreeNode> <NodeTemplate> <asp:Calendar ID="Calendar1" runat="server"></asp:Calendar> </NodeTemplate> </telerik:RadTreeNode> </Nodes> </telerik:RadTreeNode> </Nodes> </telerik:RadTreeView>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeNode.FullPath
member.summary: Gets the full path (location) of the node.
member.value: A slash delimited path of the node. The path is constructed based on the Text property of the node and its parents. For example if the Text of the node it "Houston", its parent node is "Texas" and its parent (root) is "U.S.A", FullPath will return "U.S.A/Texas/Houston"

The RadTreeNodeCollection class represents a collection of RadTreeNode objects.
Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single RadTreeNode from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of menu items in the collection.
Use the Add method to add nodes in the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove nodes from the collection.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView
member.summary: A hierarchical control used to display a tree of nodes in a web page.

remarks.para: The RadTreeView control is used to display a list of nodes in a Web Forms page. The RadTreeView control supports the following features:

list.item: Danodeinding that allows the control to be populated from various datasources.
Programmatic access to the RadTreeView object model which allows dynamic creation of treeviews, populating with nodes and customizing the behavior by various properties.
Customizable appearance through built-in or user-defined skins.

remarks.para: The RadTreeView control is made up of tree of nodes represented by objects. Nodes at the top level (level 0) are called root nodes. An node that has a parent node is called a child node. All root nodes are stored in the property of the RadTreeView control. Child nodes are stored in the property of their parent .

Each node has a and a property. The value of the property is displayed in the RadTreeView control, while the property is used to store any additional data about the node, such as data passed to the postback event associated with the node. When clicked, a node can navigate to another Web page indicated by the property.

member.remarks: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadTreeView control.

<telerik:RadTreeView runat="server" ID="RadTreeView1"> <LoadingStatusTemplate> <asp:Image runat="server" ID="Image1" ImageUrl="~/Img/loading.gif" /> </LoadingStatusTemplate> </telerik:RadTreeView>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.ClientChanges
member.summary: Gets a list of all client-side changes (adding a node, removing a node, changing a node's property) which have occurred.
member.value: A list of objects which represent all client-side changes the user has performed. By default the ClientChanges property returns empty list. Client-changes are recorded if and only if the client-side methods trackChanges()/commitChanges() have been invoked.
member.remarks:
You can use the ClientChanges property to respond to client-side modifications such as
adding a new item
removing existing item
clearing the children of an item or the control itself
changing a property of the item
The ClientChanges property is available in the first postback (ajax) request after the client-side modifications have taken place. After this moment the property will return empty list.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.CheckedNodes
member.summary: Gets a collection of RadTreeNode objects that represent the nodes in the control that display a selected check box.
member.returns: An IList<RadTreeNode> containing the checked nodes.

remarks.para: When check boxes are displayed in the RadTreeView control (by setting the CheckBoxes property to true), use the CheckedNodes property to determine which nodes display a selected check box. This collection is commonly used to iterate through all the nodes that have a selected check box in the tree.
The CheckedNodes collection is populated using a depth-first traversal of the tree structure: each parent node is processed down to its child nodes before the next parent node is populated.

example.code: Protected Sub ShowCheckedNodes(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Dim message As String = String.Empty Dim node As RadTreeNode For Each node In RadTree1.CheckedNodes message += node.FullPath Next node nodes.Text = message End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.SelectedValue
member.summary: Gets the Value of the selected node.
member.returns: The Value of the selected node. If there is no selected node returns empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.SelectedNodes
member.summary: Gets a collection of RadTreeNode objects that represent the nodes in the control that are currently selected.
member.returns: An IList<RadTreeNode> containing the selected nodes.

remarks.para: This collection is commonly used to iterate through all the nodes that have been selected in the tree.
The SelectedNodes collection is populated using a depth-first traversal of the tree structure: each parent node is processed down to its child nodes before the next parent node is populated.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.SelectedNode
member.summary: Gets a RadTreeNode object that represents the selected node in the RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: When a node is in selection mode, the user can select a node by clicking on the text in the node. Use the SelectedNode property to determine which node is selected in the TreeView control.
A node cannot be selected when the TreeView control displays hyperlinks. When hyperlinks are displayed, the SelectedNode property always returns a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

When the user selects a different node in the RadTreeView control by clicking the text in the new node, the NodeClick event is raised, by default. If you set the MultipleSelect property of the treeview to true, end-users can select multiple nodes by holding the Ctrl / Shift keys while selecting.

example.code:
<radT:RadTreeView ID="RadTree1" runat="server" OnNodeClick="NodeClick" />
Protected Sub NodeClick(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal NodeEventArgs As RadTreeNodeEventArgs) info.Text = String.Empty Dim NodeClicked As RadTreeNode = NodeEventArgs.NodeClicked info.Text = NodeClicked.Text End Sub

<radT:RadTreeView
                ID="RadTree1"
                runat="server"
                OnNodeClick="NodeClick"
            />
             
            protected void NodeClick(object sender, RadTreeNodeEventArgs NodeEventArgs)
            {
                info.Text = string.Empty;
                RadTreeNode NodeClicked = NodeEventArgs.NodeClicked;
                info.Text = NodeClicked.Text;
            }

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the RadTreeView control has no nodes.

value.para: An object implementing the ITemplate interface. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.LoadingMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the loading message that is displayed when child nodes are retrieved on AJAX calls.
member.remarks: This property can be used for localization purposes (e.g. "Loading..." in different languages).

example.code: Protected Sub LoadingMessagePositionChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case LoadingMessagePos.SelectedItem.Value Case "Before" RadTree1.LoadingStatusPosition = TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.BeforeNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ..)" Case "After" RadTree1.LoadingStatusPosition = TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.AfterNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "Below" RadTree1.LoadingStatusPosition = TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.BelowNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "None" RadTree1.LoadingStatusPosition = TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.Nodes
member.summary: Gets a object that contains the root nodes of the current RadTreeView control.
member.value: A that contains the root nodes of the current RadTreeView control. By default the collection is empty (RadTreeView has no children).
member.remarks: Use the nodes property to access the root nodes of the RadTreeView control. You can also use the nodes property to manage the root nodes - you can add, remove or modify nodes.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.LoadingStatusPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the loading message when child nodes are retrieved on AJAX calls.

example.code: Protected Sub LoadingMessagePositionChanged(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Select Case LoadingMessagePos.SelectedItem.Value Case "Before" RadTree1.LoadingStatusPosition = TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.BeforeNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ..)" Case "After" RadTree1.LoadingStatusPosition = TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.AfterNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "Below" RadTree1.LoadingStatusPosition = TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.BelowNodeText RadTree1.LoadingMessage = "(loading ...)" Case "None" RadTree1.LoadingStatusPosition = TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.None End Select End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.AllowNodeEditing
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the text of the tree nodes are edinodele in the browser.

remarks.para: End-users can edit the text of tree-nodes by pressing F2 when the node is selected or by clicking on a node that is already selected (slow double click).
You can disable / enable node editing for specific tree nodes by setting the AllowEdit property of the specific RadTreeNode.

After node editing, RadTreeView fires the NodeEdit event and you can change the text of the node - the RadTreeNode instance is contained in the NodeEdited property of the event arguments and the new text is in the NewText property of the event arguments.

example.code:
<radT:RadTreeView ID="RadTree1" Runat="server" AllowNodeEditing="True" OnNodeEdit="HandleNodeEdit" />
Protected Sub HandleNodeEdit(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal NodeEvents As RadTreeNodeEventArgs) Dim nodeEdited As RadTreeNode = NodeEvents.NodeEdited Dim newText As String = NodeEvents.NewText
nodeEdited.Text = newText End Sub

<radT:RadTreeView
                ID="RadTree1"
                Runat="server"
                AllowNodeEditing="True"
                OnNodeEdit="HandleNodeEdit"
            />
             
            protected void HandleNodeEdit(object sender, RadTreeNodeEventArgs NodeEvents)
            {            
                RadTreeNode nodeEdited = NodeEvents.NodeEdited;
                string newText = NodeEvents.NewText;
             
                nodeEdited.Text = newText;
            }

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.ShowLineImages
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the dotted lines indenting the nodes should be displayed or not.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.SingleExpandPath
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether only the current branch of the treeview is expanded.
member.remarks: The property closes all nodes that are not parents of the last expanded node. This property is only effective on the client browser - in postback modes you need to handle the logic yourself.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.CheckBoxes
member.summary: When set to true displays a checkbox next to each treenode.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.CheckChildNodes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether checking (unchecking) a node will check (uncheck) its child nodes.
member.value: true if child nodes will be checked (checked) when the user checks (unchecks) their parent node; otherwise, false. The default value is false

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.TriStateCheckBoxes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether RadTreeView should display tri-state checkboxes.
member.value: true if tri-state checkboxes should be displayed; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Enabling three state checkbox support requires the property to be set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.MultipleSelect
member.summary: When set to true the treeview allows multiple node selection (by holding down ctrl key while selecting nodes)

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.EnableDragAndDrop
member.summary: When set to true enables drag-and-drop functionality

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.EnableDragAndDropBetweenNodes
member.summary: When set to true enables drag-and-drop visual clue (underline) between nodes while draggin

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.ContextMenus
member.summary: Gets a collection of RadTreeViewContextMenu objects that represent the context menus of a RadTreeView control.
member.value: A RadTreeViewContextMenuCollection that contains all the context menus of the RadTreeView control.

remarks.para: By default, if the ContextMenus collection contains RadTreeViewContextMenus, the first one is displayed on the right-click of each RadTreeNode. To disable a context menu for a RadTreeNode, set its EnableContextMenu property to false. To specify a different context menu for a RadTreeNode, use its ContextMenuID property.

member.example: The following code example demonstrates how to populate the ContextMenus collection declaratively. <%@ Page Language="C#" AutoEventWireup="true" %> <%@ Register TagPrefix="Telerik" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" %>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.WebServiceSettings
member.summary: Gets the settings for the web service used to populate nodes when ExpandMode set to TreeNodeExpandMode.WebService.
member.value: An WebServiceSettings that represents the web service used for populating nodes.

remarks.para: Use the WebServiceSettings property to configure the web service used to populate nodes on demand. You must specify both Path and Method to fully describe the service.
You can use the LoadingStatusTemplate property to create a loading template.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.PersistLoadOnDemandNodes
member.summary: When set to true, the nodes populated through Load On Demand are persisted on the server.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.ExpandAnimation
member.summary: Gets the settings for the animation played when a node opens.
member.value: An AnnimationSettings that represents the expand animation.

remarks.para:
Use the ExpandAnimation property to customize the expand animation of RadTreeView. You can specify the Type and Duration. To disable expand animation effects you should set the Type to AnimationType.None.
To customize the collapse animation you can use the CollapseAnimation property.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to set the ExpandAnimation of RadTreeView.
ASPX:
<telerik:RadTreeView ID="RadTreeView1" runat="server">
<ExpandAnimation Type="OutQuint" Duration="300" />
<Nodes>
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="News" >
<Nodes>
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="CNN" NavigateUrl="http://www.cnn.com" />
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="Google News" NavigateUrl="http://news.google.com" />
</Nodes>
</telerik:RadTreeViewNode>
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="Sport" >
<Nodes>
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="ESPN" NavigateUrl="http://www.espn.com" />
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="Eurosport" NavigateUrl="http://www.eurosport.com" />
</Nodes>
</telerik:RadTreeViewNode>
</Nodes>
</telerik:RadTreeView>
void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e) { RadTreeView1.ExpandAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear; RadTreeView1.ExpandAnimation.Duration = 300; }
Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load RadTreeView1.ExpandAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear RadTreeView1.ExpandAnimation.Duration = 300 End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.CollapseAnimation
member.summary: Gets the settings for the animation played when a node closes.
member.value: An AnnimationSettings that represents the collapse animation.

remarks.para:
Use the CollapseAnimation property to customize the expand animation of RadTreeView. You can specify the Type and Duration.
To disable expand animation effects you should set the Type to AnimationType.None. To customize the expand animation you can use the ExpandAnimation property.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to set the CollapseAnimation of RadTreeView.
ASPX:
<telerik:RadTreeView ID="RadTreeView1" runat="server">
<CollapseAnimation Type="OutQuint" Duration="300" />
<Nodes>
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="News" >
<Nodes>
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="CNN" NavigateUrl="http://www.cnn.com" />
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="Google News" NavigateUrl="http://news.google.com" />
</Nodes>
</telerik:RadTreeViewNode>
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="Sport" >
<Nodes>
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="ESPN" NavigateUrl="http://www.espn.com" />
<telerik:RadTreeViewNode Text="Eurosport" NavigateUrl="http://www.eurosport.com" />
</Nodes>
</telerik:RadTreeViewNode>
</Nodes>
</telerik:RadTreeView>
void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e) { RadTreeView1.CollapseAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear; RadTreeView1.CollapseAnimation.Duration = 300; }
Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load RadTreeView1.CollapseAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear RadTreeView1.CollapseAnimation.Duration = 300 End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.MaxDataBindDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of levels to bind to the RadTreeView control.
member.value: The maximum number of levels to bind to the RadTreeView control. The default is -1, which binds all the levels in the data source to the control.
member.remarks: When binding the RadTreeView control to a data source, use the MaxDanodeindDepth property to limit the number of levels to bind to the control. For example, setting this property to 2 binds only the root nodes and their immediate children. All remaining records in the data source are ignored.

member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when a tree node is clicked. The default value is an empty string (""), which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.OnClientNodePopulating
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when the children of a tree node are about to be populated (for example from web service).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

example.para:
<script type="text/javascript">

                function onClientNodePopulatingHandler(sender, eventArgs)

                {

            		var node = eventArgs.get_node();

            		var context = eventArgs.get_context();

            		context["CategoryID"] = node.get_value();

                }

                </script>

remarks.para: If specified, the OnClientNodePopulating client-side event handler is called when the children of a tree node are about to be populated. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.node:
eventArgs with three properties:
get_node(), the instance of the node. get_context(), an user object that will be passed to the web service. set_cancel(), used to cancel the event.

remarks.para: This event can be cancelled.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.OnClientNodePopulated
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when the children of a tree node were just populated (for example from web service).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

example.para:
<script type="text/javascript">

                function onClientNodePopulatedHandler(sender, eventArgs)

                {

            		var node = eventArgs.get_node();

            		alert("Loading finished for " + node.get_text());

                }

                </script>

remarks.para: If specified, the OnClientNodePopulated client-side event handler is called when the children of a tree node were just populated. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the menu client object;

eventArgs with one property:
get_node(), the instance of the tree node.

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.OnClientNodePopulationFailed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when the operation for populating the children of a tree node has failed.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

example.para:
<script type="text/javascript">

                function onClientNodePopulationFailedHandler(sender, eventArgs)

                {

            		var node = eventArgs.get_node();

            		var errorMessage = eventArgs.get_errorMessage();

            		

            		alert("Error: " + errorMessage);

            		eventArgs.set_cancel(true);

                }

                </script>

remarks.para: If specified, the OnClientNodePopulationFailed client-side event handler is called when the operation to populate the children of a tree node has failed. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the menu client object;

eventArgs with three properties:
get_node(), the instance of the tree node.
set_cancel(), set to true to suppress the default action (alert message).

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.NodeClick
member.summary: Occurs on the server when a node in the control is clicked.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.NodeDataBound
member.summary: Occurs when a node is data bound.

remarks.para: The NodeDataBound event is raised for each node upon danodeinding. You can retrieve the node being bound using the event arguments. The DataItem associated with the node can be retrieved using the property.
The NodeDataBound event is often used in scenarios when you want to perform additional mapping of fields from the DataItem to their respective properties in the class.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.NodeCreated
member.summary: Occurs when a node is created.
member.remarks:
The NodeCreated event is raised when an node in the control is created, both during round-trips and at the time data is bound to the control. The NodeCreated event is not raised for nodes which are defined inline in the page or user control.
The NodeCreated event is commonly used to initialize node properties.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.NodeExpand
member.summary: Occurs when a node is expanded.

remarks.para: The NodeExpand event will be raised for nodes whose property is set to ServerSide or ServerSideCallback.
The NodeExpand event is commonly used to populate nodes on demand.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.NodeCollapse
member.summary: Occurs when a node is collapsed.
member.remarks: The NodeCollapse event is raised only for nodes whose property is set to ServerSide.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.NodeCheck
member.summary: Occurs when a node is checked.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.NodeDrop
member.summary: Occurs when a node (or nodes) is dragged and dropped.
member.remarks: The NodeDrop event is commonly used to move nodes from one location into other.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.NodeEdit
member.summary: Occurs when a node's text is edited.
member.remarks: The NodeEdit event is commonly used to update the property after editing.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeView.ContextMenuItemClick
member.summary: Occurs on the server when a item in the is clicked.
member.remarks: The context menu will also postback if you navigate to a menu item using the [menu item] key and then press [enter] on the menu item that is focused. The instance of the clicked menu item is passed to the ContextMenuItemClick event handler - you can obtain a reference to it using the eventArgs.Item property.
