member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RecurrencePattern
member.summary: Specifies the pattern that uses to evaluate the recurrence dates set.

remarks.para: The properties of the class work together to define a complete pattern definition to be used by the engine.
You should not need to work with it directly as specialized classes are provided for the supported modes of recurrence. They take care of constructing appropriate objects.

example.code:
Imports System Imports Telerik.Web.UI
Namespace RecurrenceExamples Class RecurrencePatternExample Shared Sub Main() ' Creates a sample appointment that starts at 6/1/2007 3:30 PM and lasts half an hour. Dim recurringAppointment As New Appointment("1", Convert.ToDateTime("6/1/2007 3:30 PM"), Convert.ToDateTime("6/1/2007 4:00 PM"), "Sample appointment")
' Creates a recurrence range, that specifies a limit of 10 occurrences for the appointment. Dim range As New RecurrenceRange() range.Start = recurringAppointment.Start range.EventDuration = recurringAppointment.[End] - recurringAppointment.Start range.MaxOccurrences = 10
' Creates a recurrence rule for the appointment. Dim rrule As New DailyRecurrenceRule(1, range)
' Displays the relevant parts of the generated pattern: Console.WriteLine("The active recurrence pattern is:") Console.WriteLine(" Frequency: {0}", rrule.Pattern.Frequency) Console.WriteLine(" Interval: {0}", rrule.Pattern.Interval) Console.WriteLine(" Days of week: {0}" & Chr(10) & "", rrule.Pattern.DaysOfWeekMask)
Console.WriteLine("Appointment occurrs at the following times: ") Dim ix As Integer = 0 For Each occurrence As DateTime In rrule.Occurrences ix = ix + 1 Console.WriteLine("{0,2}: {1}", ix, occurrence.ToLocalTime()) Next End Sub End Class End Namespace
' 'This example produces the following results: ' 'The active recurrence pattern is: ' Frequency: Daily ' Interval: 1 ' Days of week: EveryDay ' 'Appointment occurrs at the following times: ' 1: 6/1/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 2: 6/2/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 3: 6/3/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 4: 6/4/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 5: 6/5/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 6: 6/6/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 7: 6/7/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 8: 6/8/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 9: 6/9/2007 3:30:00 PM '10: 6/10/2007 3:30:00 PM '

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RecurrencePattern.DayOfMonth
member.summary: Gets or sets the day month on which the event recurs.
member.value: The day month on which the event recurs.

remarks.para: This property is meaningful only when is set to or and is not set.
In such scenario it selects the n-th occurrence within the set of events specified by the rule. Valid values are from -31 to +31, 0 is ignored.
For example with RecurrenceFrequency set to Monthly and DaysOfWeekMask set to Monday DayOfMonth is interpreted in the following way:

ul.li: 1: Selects the first monday of the month.
3: Selects the third monday of the month.
-1: Selects the last monday of the month.

remarks.para: For detailed examples see the documentation of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the day on which the week starts.
member.value: This property is only meaningful when is set to and is greater than 1.

summary.para: Specifies the time frame for which given is active. It consists of the start time of the event, it's duration and optional limits.

remarks.para: Limits for both occurrence count and end date can be specified via the and properties.
Start and EventDuration properties refer to the recurring event's start and duration. In the context of they are usually derived from and .

Imports System Imports Telerik.Web.UI
Namespace RecurrenceExamples Class RecurrenceRangeExample Shared Sub Main() ' Creates a sample appointment that starts at 6/1/2007 3:30 PM and lasts half an hour. ' Creates a recurrence range, that specifies a limit of 10 occurrences for the appointment. Dim range As New RecurrenceRange() range.Start = recurringAppointment.Start range.EventDuration = recurringAppointment.[End] - recurringAppointment.Start range.MaxOccurrences = 10
' Creates a daily recurrence rule for the appointment. Dim rrule As New DailyRecurrenceRule(1, range)
Console.WriteLine("Appointment occurrs at the following times: ") Dim ix As Integer = 0 For Each occurrence As DateTime In rrule.Occurrences ix = ix + 1 Console.WriteLine("{0,2}: {1}", ix, occurrence.ToLocalTime()) Next End Sub End Class End Namespace
' 'This example produces the following results: ' 'Appointment occurrs at the following times: ' 1: 6/1/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 2: 6/2/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 3: 6/3/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 4: 6/4/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 5: 6/5/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 6: 6/6/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 7: 6/7/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 8: 6/8/2007 3:30:00 PM ' 9: 6/9/2007 3:30:00 PM '10: 6/10/2007 3:30:00 PM '

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.WeeklyRecurrenceRule
member.summary: Occurrences of this rule repeat on a weekly basis.

example.code:
Imports System Imports Telerik.Web.UI
Namespace RecurrenceExamples Class WeeklyRecurrenceRuleExample Shared Sub Main() ' Creates a sample appointment that starts at 6/1/2007 3:30 PM (local time) and lasts half an hour. Dim recurringAppointment As New Appointment("1", Convert.ToDateTime("6/1/2007 3:30 PM"), Convert.ToDateTime("6/1/2007 4:00 PM"), "Sample appointment")
' Creates a recurrence range, that specifies a limit of 10 occurrences for the appointment. Dim range As New RecurrenceRange() range.Start = recurringAppointment.Start range.EventDuration = recurringAppointment.[End] - recurringAppointment.Start range.MaxOccurrences = 10
' Creates a recurrence rule to repeat the appointment every two weeks on Mondays and Tuesdays. Dim mask As RecurrenceDay = RecurrenceDay.Monday Or RecurrenceDay.Tuesday Dim rrule As New WeeklyRecurrenceRule(2, mask, range)
Console.WriteLine("Appointment occurrs at the following times: ") Dim ix As Integer = 0 For Each occurrence As DateTime In rrule.Occurrences ix = ix + 1 Console.WriteLine("{0,2}: {1} ({2})", ix, occurrence.ToLocalTime(), occurrence.DayOfWeek) Next End Sub End Class End Namespace
' 'This example produces the following results: ' 'Appointment occurrs at the following times: ' 1: 6/4/2007 3:30:00 PM (Monday) ' 2: 6/5/2007 3:30:00 PM (Tuesday) ' 3: 6/18/2007 3:30:00 PM (Monday) ' 4: 6/19/2007 3:30:00 PM (Tuesday) ' 5: 7/2/2007 3:30:00 PM (Monday) ' 6: 7/3/2007 3:30:00 PM (Tuesday) ' 7: 7/16/2007 3:30:00 PM (Monday) ' 8: 7/17/2007 3:30:00 PM (Tuesday) ' 9: 7/30/2007 3:30:00 PM (Monday) '10: 7/31/2007 3:30:00 PM (Tuesday) '

' Creates a recurrence rule to repeat the appointment on the second monday of April each year. Dim rrule As New YearlyRecurrenceRule(2, RecurrenceMonth.April, RecurrenceDay.Monday, range)
Console.WriteLine("Appointment occurrs at the following times: ") Dim ix As Integer = 0 For Each occurrence As DateTime In rrule.Occurrences ix = ix + 1 Console.WriteLine("{0,2}: {1}", ix, occurrence.ToLocalTime()) Next End Sub End Class End Namespace
' 'This example produces the following results: ' 'Appointment occurrs at the following times: ' 1: 4/9/2007 10:00:00 AM ' 2: 4/14/2008 10:00:00 AM ' 3: 4/13/2009 10:00:00 AM ' 4: 4/12/2010 10:00:00 AM ' 5: 4/11/2011 10:00:00 AM '

member.param: The day ordinal modifier. See for additional information.
The month in which the event recurs.
A bit mask that specifies the week days on which the event recurs.
The instance that specifies the range of this rule.

list.item: sender, the RadToolTip object.
args.

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolTipBase.OnClientBeforeHide

args.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolTipBase.OnClientHide

list.item: sender, the RadToolTip object.
args.

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolTipManager.OnAjaxUpdate(Telerik.Web.UI.ToolTipUpdateEventArgs)
member.summary: Allows for dynamic content to be set into the tooltip with an ajax request. The tooltip triggers the event when it is shown on the client.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the server-side event handler that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: If specified, the OnAjaxUpdate is triggered when the tooltip is shown on the client. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the RadToolTip object.
args.

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the OnAjaxUpdate property.
<telerik:RadToolTip ID="RadToolTip1"
runat= "server"
OnAjaxUpdate="OnAjaxUpdate">
....
</telerik:RadToolTip>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolTipManager.WebServiceSettings

remarks.para: Use the WebServiceSettings property to configure the web service used to populate items on demand. You must specify both Path and Method to fully describe the service.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolTipManager.OnClientResponseEnd

args.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFile

summary.para: Provides a way to access individual files that have been uploaded by a client via a RadUpload control.

remarks.para: The UploadedFileCollection class provides access to all files uploaded from a client via single RadUpload instance as a file collection. UploadedFile provides properties and methods to get information on an individual file and to read and save the file. Files are uploaded in MIME multipart/form-data format and are NOT buffered in the server memory if the RadUploadModule is used.
The RadUpload control must be used to select and upload files from a client.
You can specify the maximum allowable upload file size in a machine.config or Web.config configuration file in the maxRequestLength attribute of the <httpRuntime> Element element.

member.example:
Set the maximum allowable upload file size to 1000kB
<httpRuntime maxRequestLength="1000" />
<httpRuntime maxRequestLength="1000" />

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFile.GetName
member.summary: Returns the name and extension of the file on the client's computer.
member.value: A string consisting of the characters after the last directory character in file name on the client's computer.
member.remarks: The separator characters used to determine the start of the file name are DirectorySeparatorChar and AltDirectorySeparatorChar.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFile.GetNameWithoutExtension
member.summary: Returns the name of the file on the client's computer without the extension.
member.value: A string containing the name of the file on the client's computer without the extension.
member.remarks: A string containing the string returned by GetFileName, minus the last period (.) and all characters following it.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFile.GetExtension
member.summary: Returns the extension of the file on the client's computer.
member.value: A string containing the extension of the file including the ".". If the file name does not have extension information, GetExtension returns string.Empty.
member.remarks: The extension of the file name is obtained by searching it for a period (.), starting with the last character and continuing toward the start. If a period is found before a DirectorySeparatorChar or AltDirectorySeparatorChar character, the returned string contains the period and the characters after it; otherwise, string.Empty is returned.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFile.GetFieldValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of a custom field.
member.value: A string containing the value of the custom field with name fieldName
member.param: The name of the field wich value will be retrieved
member.returns: Check the general help for more information and an example.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFile.GetIsFieldChecked(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the checked state of a custom field.
member.value: A string containing the checked state of the custom field with name fieldName
member.param: The name of the field wich checked state will be retrieved
member.returns: Check the general help for more information and an example.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFile.SaveAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the contents of an uploaded file.

remarks.para: The maximum allowed uploaded file size is 4MB by default. Maximum file size can be specified in the machine.config or Web.config configuration files in the maxRequestLength attribute of the <httpRuntime> element.
The ASP.NET process must have proper rights for writing on the folder where the files are saved.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFile.SaveAs(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the contents of an uploaded file.

remarks.para: The maximum allowed uploaded file size is 4MB by default. Maximum file size can be specified in the machine.config or Web.config configuration files in the maxRequestLength attribute of the <httpRuntime> element.
The ASP.NET process must have proper rights for writing on the folder where the files are saved.

member.param: The name of the saved file.
true to allow an existing file to be overwritten; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the period (in milliseconds) of the progress data refresh.

member.summary: Fires the FileExists event.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.ValidatingFile
member.summary: Occurs before the internal validation of every file in the UploadedFiles collection.

remarks.para: To skip the internal validation of the file, set e.SkipInternalValidation = true.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.FileExists
member.summary: Occurs after an unsuccessful attempt for automatic saving of a file in the UploadedFiles collection.

remarks.para: This event should be consumed only when the automatic file saving is enabled by setting the TargetFolder property. In this mode the files are saved in the selected folder with the same name as on the client computer. If a file with such name already exists in the TargetFolder it is either overwritten or skipped depending the value of the OverwriteExistingFiles property. This event is fired if OverwriteExistingFiles is set to false and a file with the same name already exists in the TargetFolder.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.InputSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the file input field
member.value: The default value is 23.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.AllowedFileExtensions
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed file extensions for uploading.

remarks.para: Set this property to empty array of strings in order to prevent the file extension checking.
Note that the file extensions must include the dot before the actual extension. See the example below.

member.value: The default value is empty string array. In order to check for multiple file extensions you should set an array of strings containing the allowed file extensions for uploading.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.AllowedMimeTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets the allowed MIME types for uploading.

remarks.para: Set this property to string.Empty in order to prevent the mime type checking.

member.value: The default value is empty string array. In order to check for multiple mime types you should set an array of strings containing the allowed MIME types for uploading.

member.remarks:
ControlObjectVisibility enum members
Member Description
None Only the file inputs will be visible.
CheckBoxes Display checkboxes for selecting a file input.
RemoveButtons Display buttons for removing a file input.
ClearButtons Display buttons for clearing a file input.
AddButton Display button for adding a file input.
DeleteSelectedButton Display button for removing the file inputs with checked checkboxes.
Default CheckBoxes | RemoveButtons | AddButton | DeleteSelectedButton
All CheckBoxes | RemoveButtons | ClearButtons | AddButton | DeleteSelectedButton

member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether RadUpload should overwrite existing files having same name in the TargetFolder.
member.value: true when the existing files should be overwritten; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.ReadOnlyFileInputs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the file input fields should be read-only (e.g. no typing allowed).
member.value: true when the file input fields should be read-only; otherwise false.
member.remarks: When users type into the box and the filename is not valid, the form submission in Internet Explorer could not proceed or even display a javascript error. This behavior can be avoided by setting the ReadOnlyFileInputs property to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.TargetFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual path of the folder, where RadUpload will automatically save the valid files after the upload completes.
member.value: A string containing the virtual path of the folder where RadUpload will automatically save the valid files after the upload completes. The default value is string.Empty.

remarks.para: When set to string.Empty, the files must be saved manually to the desired location.
If both TargetPhysicalFolder property and this property are set, the TargetPhysicalFolder will override the virtual path provided by TargetFolder.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.TargetPhysicalFolder
member.summary: Gets or sets the physical path of the folder, where RadUpload will automatically save the valid files after the upload completes.
member.value: A string containing the physical path of the folder where RadUpload will automatically save the valid files after the upload completes. The default value is string.Empty.

remarks.para: When set to string.Empty, the files must be saved manually to the desired location.
If both TargetFolder property and this property are set, the TargetPhysicalFolder will override the virtual path provided by TargetFolder.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.UploadedFiles
member.summary: Provides access to the valid files uploaded by the RadUpload instance.
member.value: UploadedFileCollection containing all valid files uploaded using a RadUpload control.
member.remarks: The collection contains only the files uploaded with the particular instance of the RadUpload control. If the RadUploadHttpModule is used, the uploaded files are removed from the Request.Files collection in order to conserve the server's memory. Else the Request.Files contains all uploaded files as a HttpPostedFile collection and each RadUpload instance has its own uploaded files as UploadedFileCollection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.FocusOnLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the first file input field of RadUpload should get the focus on itself on load.
member.value: true when the first file input field of RadUpload should get the focus; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadUpload.IsUploadModuleRegistered
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the RadUpload HttpModule is registered in the current web.application

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFileCollection
member.summary: Provides access to and organizes files uploaded by a client.
member.remarks: Clients encode files and transmit them in the content body using multipart MIME format with an HTTP Content-Type header of multipart/form-data. RadUpload extracts the encoded file(s) from the content body into individual members of an UploadedFileCollection. Methods and properties of the UploadedFile class provide access to the contents and properties of each file.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.UploadedFileCollection.Item(System.Int32)

summary.para: Gets an individual UploadedFile object from the file collection.
In C#, this property is the indexer for the UploadedFileCollection class.

member.value: The UploadedFile specified by index.
member.param: The index of the item to get from the file collection.

args.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.ColorPickerItemCollection
member.summary: A collection of ColorPickerItem objects in a RadColorPicker control.

remarks.para: The ColorPickerItemCollection class represents a collection of ColorPickerItem objects. The ColorPickerItem objects in turn represent Colors items within a RadColorPicker control.

list.item: Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single ColorPickerItem from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of Items in the collection.
Use the Add method to add Items in the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove Items from the collection.

member.value: (WebPalette | RGBSliders)

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadColorPicker.OnColorChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the server-side event handler that is called when the value of the ColorPicker has been changed.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the server-side event handler that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: If specified, the OnColorChanged event handler that is called when the value of the ColorPicker has been changed. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the RadColorPicker object.
args.

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the OnColorChanged property.
<telerik:RadColorPicker ID="RadColorPicker1"
runat= "server"
OnColorChanged="OnColorChanged">
....
</telerik:RadColorPicker>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadFileExplorer.LocalizationPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating where the control will look for its .resx localization files. By default these files should be in the App_GlobalResources folder. However, if you cannot put the resource files in the default location or .resx files compilation is disabled for some reason (e.g. in a DotNetNuke environment), this property should be set to the location of the resource files.
member.value: A relative path to the dialogs location. For example: "~/controls/RadEditorResources/".

remarks.para: If specified, the LocalizationPath property will allow you to load the control localization files from any location in the web application.

member.summary: Binds the ticker to a IEnumerable data source
member.param: IEnumerable data source

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTicker.Items
member.summary: The collection that holds all RadTickerItem objects.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTicker.AutoStart
member.summary: Specifies whether the ticker begins ticking automatically.
member.remarks: You should leave this set to false if you are using the ticker within a RadTicker If you use the ticker independently and leave this setting to false you should use the client API call ticker_id.startTicker() to start it.
member.value: Default: False

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTicker.AutoAdvance
member.summary: Specifies whether will begin ticking the next tickerline (if any) after it has finished ticking the current one.
member.remarks: If you set the AutoAdvance property to false, then you will have to use a client API Call ticker_id.tickNextLine()
member.value: Default: True

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTicker.Loop
member.summary: Specifies whether will repeat the first tickerline after displaying the last one.
member.remarks: If you set this property to true RadTicker will never finish ticking. This may have possible implications when having more than one instance in a . This way works is that when the first ticker on a frame has finished ticking it will start ticking the next ticker on the frame. If a instance is ticking (has Loop=true) it will never finish and the next ticker on the frame will not get started.
member.value: Default: False

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTicker.TickSpeed
member.summary: Specifies the duration in milliseconds between ticking each character of a tickerline. The lower the value the faster a line will finish ticking.
member.value: Default: 20ms

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTicker.LineDuration
member.summary: Specifies in milliseconds the pause makes before starting to tick the next line (if AutoAdvance=True).
member.value: Default: 2000ms

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTicker.AutoPostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a postback to the server automatically occurs when the user interacts with the control.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true will make Telerik RadTicker postback to the server on item click.
member.value: The default value is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTicker.DataTextField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field of the data source that provides the value of the ticker lines.
member.value: A string that specifies the field of the data source that provides the value of the ticker lines. The default value is an empty string.
member.remarks: Use the DataTextField property to specify the field of the data source (in most cases the name of the database column) which provides the values for the Text property of databound ticker items. The DataTextField property is taken into account only during data binding. If the DataTextField property is not set and your datasource is not a list of strings, the RadTicker control will throw an exception.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.SchedulerResourcePopulationMode
member.summary: Specifies the resource population mode of a RadScheduler control when using Web Service data binding.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.SchedulerResourcePopulationMode.Manual
member.summary: In manual mode RadScheduler will not request resources from the Web Service. They can be populated from the code-behind of the ASP.NET page that hosts the RadScheduler control.
member.remarks: This mode is useful when server-side requests from the server are undesirable or forbidden (Medium Trust for example).

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.SchedulerResourcePopulationMode.ServerSide
member.summary: The resources will be populated from the server by issuing a request to the Web Service.
member.remarks: The ResourcesPopulating event will be raised.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.SchedulerResourcePopulationMode.ClientSide
member.summary: The resources will be populated from the client by issuing a request to the Web Service.
member.remarks: The ResourcesPopulating client-side event will be raised. Grouped views are not supported in this mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.SchedulerWebServiceSettings.RemoveRecurrenceExceptionsMethod

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.SchedulerWebServiceSettings.ResourcePopulationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the resource population mode to be used from RadScheduler.
member.value: The resource population mode to be used from RadScheduler. The default value is ClientSide

remarks.para: Resources need to be populated from the server when using resource grouping. Doing so also reduces the client-side initialization time.
This operation requires the WebPermission to be granted for the Web Service URL. This permission is not granted by default in Medium Trust.

You can disable the population of the resources from the server and still use client-side rendering for grouped views. To do so you need to set the value to Manual and populate the resources from the OnInit method of the page.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSliderItemCollection
member.summary: A collection of RadSliderItem objects in a RadSlider control.
member.remarks:
The RadSliderItemCollection class represents a collection of RadSliderItem objects.
Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single RadSliderItem from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of slider items in the collection.
Use the Add method to add items in the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove items from the collection.

member.summary: A collection of RadPageView objects in a RadMultiPage control.
member.remarks:
The RadPageViewCollection class represents a collection of RadPageView objects.
Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single RadPageView from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of RadPageView controls in the collection.
Use the Add method to add RadPageView controls to the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove RadPageView controls from the collection.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip
member.summary: A navigation control used to create tabbed interfaces.

remarks.para: The RadTabStrip control is used to display a list of tabs in a Web Forms page and is often used in combination with a RadMultiPage control for building tabbed interfaces. The RadTabStrip control supports the following features:

list.item: Databinding that allows the control to be populated from various datasources
Programmatic access to the RadTabStrip object model which allows to dynamic creation of tabstrips, populate h tabs, set properties.
Customizable appearance through built-in or user-defined skins.

remarks.para: The RadTabStrip control is made up of tree of tabs represented by RadTab objects. Tabs at the top level (level 0) are called root tabs. A tab that has a parent tab is called a child tab. All root tabs are stored in the Tabs collection. Child tabs are stored in a parent tab's Tabs collection.

Each tab has a Text and a Value property. The value of the Text property is displayed in the RadTabStrip control, while the Value property is used to store any additional data about the tab, such as data passed to the postback event associated with the tab. When clicked, a tab can navigate to another Web page indicated by the NavigateUrl property.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadTabStrip class.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadTabStrip control.

member.returns: A RadTab whose Value property is equal to the specifed value. If a tab is not found, null (Nothing in Visual Basic) is returned.

A Boolean indicating a case-sensitive or insensitive comparison (true indicates a case-insensitive comparison).

A Boolean indicating a case-sensitive or insensitive comparison (true indicates a case-insensitive comparison).

member.summary: Returns the first RadTab that matches the conditions defined by the specified predicate. The predicate should returns a boolean value.
member.param: The Predicate <> that defines the conditions of the element to search for.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.ClientChanges
member.summary: Gets a list of all client-side changes (adding a tab, removing a tab, changing a tab's property) which have occurred.
member.value: A list of objects which represent all client-side changes the user has performed. By default the ClientChanges property returns empty list. Client-changes are recorded if and only if the client-side methods trackChanges()/commitChanges() have been invoked.
member.remarks:
You can use the ClientChanges property to respond to client-side modifications such as
adding a new tab removing existing tab clearing the children of a tab or the control itself changing a property of the tab
The ClientChanges property is available in the first postback (ajax) request after the client-side modifications have taken place. After this moment the property will return empty list.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.ScrollChildren
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the immediate children of the RadTabStrip control will be scrollable.
member.value: true if the child tabs will be scrollable; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.ScrollButtonsPosition
member.summary: The position of the scroll buttons with regards to the tab band.
member.remarks: This property is applicable when the ScrollChildren property is set to true; otherwise it is ignored.
member.value: One of the TabStripScrollButtonsPosition enumeration values. The default value is Right.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.ScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the scrollable band of tabs relative to the beginning of the scrolling area.
member.remarks: This property is applicable when the ScrollChildren property is set to true; otherwise it is ignored.
member.value: An integer specifying the initial scrolling position (measured in pixels). The default value is 0 (no offset from the default scrolling position). Use negative values to move the tabs to the left.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.PerTabScrolling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tabstrip should scroll directly to the next tab.
member.value: true if the tabstrip should scroll to the next (or previous) tab; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: By default tabs are scrolled smoothly. If you want the tabstrip to scroll directly to the next (or previous) tab set this property to true. This property is applicable when the ScrollChildren property is set to true; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected child tab.
member.value: The zero based index of the selected tab. The default value is -1 (no child tab is selected).
member.remarks: Use the SelectedIndex property to programmatically specify the selected child tab in a IRadTabContainer (RadTabStrip or RadTab). To clear the selection set the SelectedIndex property to -1.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.SelectedTab
member.summary: Gets the selected child tab.
member.value: Returns the child tab which is currently selected. If no tab is selected (the SelectedIndex property is -1) the SelectedTab property will return null (Nothing in VB.NET).

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.Tabs
member.summary: Gets a RadTabCollection object that contains the root tabs of the current RadTabStrip control.
member.value: A RadTabCollection that contains the root tabs of the current RadTabStrip control. By default the collection is empty (RadTabStrip has no children).
member.remarks: Use the Tabs property to access the child tabs of RadTabStrip. You can also use the Tabs property to manage the root tabs. You can add, remove or modify tabs from the Tabs collection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.TabTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying all tabs in the control.

value.para: An object implementing the ITemplateThe default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.
To specify unique display for specific tabs use the property of the class.

member.example: The following example demonstrates how to customize the appearance of all tabs <%# DataBinder.Eval(Container, "Text") %> protected void Page_Load(object sender, System.EventArgs e) { if (!Page.IsPostBack) { //Required to evaluate the databinding expressions inside the template (<%# DataBinder.Eval)%> RadTabStrip1.DataBind(); } } Private Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load If Not Page.IsPostBack Then RadTabStrip1.DataBind() End If End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.AutoPostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether tabs should postback when clicked.
member.value: True if tabs should postback; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
RadTabStrip will postback provided one of the following conditions is met:
The AutoPostBack property is set to true.
The user has subscribed to the TabClick event.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.DataBindings
member.summary: Gets a collection of objects that define the relationship between a data item and the tab it is binding to.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.AppendDataBoundItems

summary.para: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether child tabs are cleared before data binding.

remarks.para: The AppendDataBoundTabs property allows you to add items to the RadTabStrp control before data binding occurs. After data binding, the items collection contains both the items from the data source and the previously added items.
The value of this property is stored in view state.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.MaxDataBindDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of levels to bind to the RadTabStrip control.
member.value: The maximum number of levels to bind to the RadTabStrip control. The default is -1, which binds all the levels in the data source to the control.
member.remarks: When binding the RadTabStrip control to a data source, use the MaxDataBindDepth property to limit the number of levels to bind to the control. For example, setting this property to 2 binds only the root tabs and their immediate children. All remaining records in the data source are ignored.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.DataTextField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field of the data source that provides the text content of the tabs.
member.value: A string that specifies the field of the data source that provides the text content of the tabs. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the DataTextField property to specify the field of the data source (in most cases the name of the database column) which provides values for the Text property of databound tabs. The DataTextField property is taken into account only during data binding.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.DataValueField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field of the data source that provides the value of the tabs.
member.value: A string that specifies the field of the data source that provides the value of the tabs. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the DataValueField property to specify the field of the data source (in most cases the name of the database column) which provides the values for the Value property of databound tabs. The DataValueField property is taken into account only during data binding. If the DataValueField property is not set the Value property of databound tabs will have its default value - empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.DataNavigateUrlField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field of the data source that provides the URL to which tabs navigate.
member.value: A string that specifies the field of the data source that provides the URL to which tabs will navigate. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the DataNavigateUrlField property to specify the field of the data source (in most cases the name of the database column) which provides the values for the NavigateUrl property of databound tabs. The DataNavigateUrlField property is taken into account only during data binding. If the DataNavigateUrlField property is not set the NavigateUrl property of databound tabs will have its default value - empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.DataFieldID
member.summary: Gets or sets the field from the data source which is the "child" column in the "parent-child" relationship used to databind the RadTabStrip control.
member.value: A string that specifies the field of the data source that will be the "child" column during databinding. The default is empty string.
member.remarks: RadTabStrip requires both DataFieldID and DataFieldParentID properties to be set in order to be hierarchically databound.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.DataFieldParentID
member.summary: Gets or sets the field from the data source which is the "parent" column in the "parent-child" relationship used to databind the RadTabStrip control.
member.value: A string that specifies the field of the data source that will be the "parent" column during databinding. The default is empty string.

remarks.para: RadTabStrip requires both DataFieldID and DataFieldParentID properties to be set in order to be hierarchically databound.
The value of the column specified by DataFieldParentID must be null (Nothing) for root tabs. This is a requirement for databinding RadTabStrip.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.DataTextFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the formatting string used to control how text to the tabstrip control is displayed.

remarks.para: Use the DataTextFormatString property to provide a custom display format for text of the tabs. The data format string consists of two parts, separated by a colon, in the form { A: Bxx }. For example, the formatting string {0:F2} would display a fixed point number with two decimal places.
The entire string must be enclosed in braces to indicate that it is a format string and not a literal string. Any text outside the braces is displayed as literal text.
The value before the colon (A in the general example) specifies the parameter index in a zero-based list of parameters. This value can only be set to 0.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.InnermostSelectedTab
member.summary: Gets the innermost selected tab in a hierarchical RadTabStrip control.
member.remarks: In hierarchical tabstrips this property returns the innermost selected tab.
member.value: Returns the inner most selected child tab in hierarchical tabstrip scenarios. Null (Nothing in VB.NET) if no tab is selected.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.ValidationGroup

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs.

member.value: The name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: This property works only when CausesValidation is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.PostBackUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip is clicked.
member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip control is clicked. The default value is an empty string (""), which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.MultiPageID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the RadMultiPage control that will be controlled by the current RadTabStrip control.
member.remarks:
You should use different value depending on the following conditions:
Use the ID property of the RadMuitiPage control if the RadMultiPage control is in the same INamingContainer (user control, page, content page, master page) as the current RadTabStrip control.
Use the UniqueID property of the RadMuitiPage control if the RadMultiPage control is in a different INamingContainer (user control, page, content page, master page) than the current RadTabStrip control.
member.value: The ID of the associated RadMultiPage. The default value is empty string.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to associate a RadMultiPage control with a RadTabStrip control through the MultiPageID property.
<telerik:RadTabStrip id="RadTabStrip1" runat="server" MultiPageID="RadMultiPage1">
<Tabs>
<telerik:RadTab Text="Personal Details"></telerik:RadTab>
<telerik:RadTab Text="Education"></telerik:RadTab>
<telerik:RadTab Text="Computing Skills"></telerik:RadTab>
</Tabs>
</telerik:RadTabStrip>
<telerik:RadMultiPage id="RadMultiPage1" runat="server">
.....
</telerik:RadMultiPage>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.MultiPage
member.summary: Gets the associated RadMultiPage control if the MultiPageID property is set.
member.value: The RadMultiPage control associated with the current RadTabStrip control. Will return null (Nothing in VB.NET) if the MultiPageID is not set or a corresponding RadMultiPage control cannot be found

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.ClickSelectedTab
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tabstrip should postback when the user clicks the currently selected tab.
member.value: True if the tabstrip should postback when the user clicks the currently selected tab; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the orientation of child tabs within the RadTabStrip control.
member.value: One of the TabStripOrientation values. The default value is HorizontalTopToBottom.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.Align
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the tabs in the RadTabStrip control.
member.value: One of the TabStripAlign enumeration values. The default value is Left.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.ReorderTabsOnSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the row of the selected tab should move to the bottom.
member.value: true if the row containing the selected tab should be moved to the bottom; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Use the ReorderTabsOnSelect property to mimic the behavior of the Windows tabstrip control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.ShowBaseLine
member.summary: Shows or hides the image at the base of the first level of tabs.
member.value: true if line is visible; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.UnSelectChildren
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining whether child tabs are unselected when a parent tab is unselected.
member.value: true if child tabs are unselected when a parent tab is unselected. false if the tabs persist their state even when hidden. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.CausesValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation is performed when a tab within the RadTabStrip control is selected.
member.value: true if validation is performed when a tab is selected; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

remarks.para: By default, page validation is performed when a tab is selected. Page validation determines whether the input controls associated with a validation control on the page all pass the validation rules specified by the validation control. You can specify or determine whether validation is performed on both the client and the server when a tab is clicked by using the CausesValidation property. To prevent validation from being performed, set the CausesValidation property to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.OnClientTabSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called after selecting a tab.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientTabSelected property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed after a tab is selected - either by left-clicking it with a mouse or hitting enter after tabbing to that tab.
Two parameters are passed to the handler

list.item: sender (the client-side RadTabStrip object)

eventArgs with one property
tab - the instance of the selected tab

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.OnClientContextMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called before the browser context menu shows (after right-clicking an item).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientContextMenu property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed before the context menu shows after right clicking a tab.
Two parameters are passed to the handler

list.item: sender (the client-side RadTabStrip object)

eventArgs with two properties
tab - the instance of the selected tab
domEvent - the browser DOM event

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.OnClientDoubleClick
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when the user double-clicks a tab.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientDoubleClick property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed when the user double-clicks a tab.
Two parameters are passed to the handler

list.item: sender (the client-side RadTabStrip object)

eventArgs with two properties
tab - the instance of the selected tab
domEvent - the browser DOM event

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.OnClientTabSelecting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called just prior to selecting a tab.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para:
Use the OnClientTabSelecting property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed prior to tab selecting - either by left-clicking it with a mouse or hitting enter after tabbing to that tab. You can cancel that event (prevent tab selecting) by seting the cancel property of the event argument to true.
Two parameters are passed to the handler
sender (the client-side RadTabStrip object)
eventArgs with one property
tab - the instance of the selected tab
cancel - whether to cancel the event

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.OnClientMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when the mouse hovers a tab in the RadTabStrip control.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientMouseOver property to specify a JavaScript function that is called when the user hovers a tab with the mouse.
Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender (the client-side RadTabStrip object);

eventArgs with two properties
tab - the instance of the tab that is being hovered
domEvent - the instance of the browser event.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.OnClientMouseOut
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when the mouse leaves a tab in the RadTabStrip control.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientMouseOut property to specify a JavaScript function that is executed whenever the user moves the mouse away from a particular tab in the RadTabStrip control.

para.font: Two parameters are passed to the handler:

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.OnClientTabUnSelected
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called after a tab is unselected (i.e. the user has selected another tab).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientTabUnSelected property to specify a JavaScript function that is executed after a tab is unselected.

para.font: Two parameters are passed to the handler:

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.OnClientLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the javascript function called when the control is fully initialized on the client side.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the javascript function called when the control is fully initialized on the client side. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientLoad property to specify a JavaScript function that is executed after the control is initialized on the client side. A single parameter is passed to the handler, which is the client-side RadTabStrip object.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the OnClientLoad property.
<script language="javascript">
function ClientTabstripLoad(tabstrip, eventArgs)
{
alert(tabstrip.get_id() + " is loaded.");
}
</script>
<telerik:RadTabStrip id="RadTabStrip1" runat="server" OnClientLoad="ClientTabstripLoad">
<Tabs>
<telerik:RadTab Text="Personal Details"></telerik:RadTab>
<telerik:RadTab Text="Education"></telerik:RadTab>
<telerik:RadTab Text="Computing Skills"></telerik:RadTab>
</Tabs>
</telerik:RadTabStrip>

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.TabCreated
member.summary: Occurs when a tab is created.
member.remarks:
The TabCreated event is raised when an tab in the RadTabStrip control is created, both during round-trips and at the time data is bound to the control. The TabCreated event is not raised for tabs which are defined inline in the page or user control.
The TabCreated event is commonly used to initialize tab properties.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.TabDataBound
member.summary: Occurs when a tab is data bound.

remarks.para: The TabDataBound event is raised for each tab upon databinding. You can retrieve the tab being bound using the event arguments. The DataItem associated with the tab can be retrieved using the DataItem property.
The TabDataBound event is often used in scenarios when you want to perform additional mapping of fields from the DataItem to their respective properties in the Tab class.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabStrip.TabClick
member.summary: Occurs on the server when a tab in the RadTabStrip control is clicked.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab
member.summary: Represents a tab in the RadTabStrip control.

remarks.para: The RadTabStrip control is made up of tabs. Tabs which are immediate children of the tabstrip are root tabs. tabs which are children of root tabs are child tabs.

A tab usually stores data in two properties, the Text property and the Value property. The value of the Text property is displayed in the RadTabStrip control, and the Value property is used to store additional data.
To create tabs, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to define tabs inline in your page or user control.
Use one of the constructors to dynamically create new instances of the RadTab class. These tabs can then be added to the Tabs collection of another tab or tabstrip.
Data bind the RadTabStrip control to a data source.

remarks.para: When the user clicks a tab, the RadTabStrip control can navigate to a linked Web page, post back to the server or select that tab. If the NavigateUrl property of a tab is set, the RadTabStrip control navigates to the linked page. By default, a linked page is displayed in the same window or frame. To display the linked content in a different window or frame, use the Target property.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadTab class.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadTab class using default values.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadTab class with the specified text data.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadTab class using the specified text.
member.param: The text displayed for the tab. The Text property is initialized with the value of this parameter.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadTab class with the specified text and value data.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadTab class using the specified text and value.

member.param: The text displayed for the tab. The Text property is initialized with the value of this argument.
The value associated with the tab. The Value property is initialized with the value of this parameter.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.SelectParents
member.summary: Selects recursively all parent tabs in the hierarchy.
member.remarks: Use this method to programmatically select all parents of the tab. Selected tabs will be visible in the browser.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.IsSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tab will behave as separator.
member.value: true if the tab is separator; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Use separators to visually separate the tabs. You also need to specify the width of the separator tab through the Width property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.TabTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the tab.

value.para: An object implementing the ITemplateThe default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.
To specify common display for all tabs use the property of the control.

member.example: The following example demonstrates how to customize the appearance of a specific tab using the TabTemplate property Tab 1

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.Level
member.summary: Gets the level of the current tab.
member.value: An integer representing the level of the tab. Root tabs are level 0 (zero).

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.Selected
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tab is selected.
member.value: true if the tab is selected; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Use the Selected property to determine whether the tab is currently selected within its parent RadTabCollection. Setting the Selected property to true will deselect the previously selected tab.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.TabStrip
member.summary: Gets the RadTabStrip instance which contains the current tab.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.PostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether clicking on the tab will postback.
member.value: true if the node should postback; otherwise false.
member.remarks: If you subscribe to the TabClick event all tabs will postback. To prevent the current tab from initiating postback you can set the PostBack property to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.DataItem
member.summary: Gets the data item that is bound to the tab
member.value: An Object that represents the data item that is bound to the tab. The default value is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that the tab is not bound to any data item. The return value will always be null unless accessed within a TabDataBound event handler.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only during data binding. Use it along with the TabDataBound event to perform additional mapping of fields from the data item to RadTab properties.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.ScrollChildren
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the children of the tab will be scrollable.
member.value: true if the child tabs will be scrollable; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: To enable scrolling of the child tabs the ScrollChildren property must also be set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.ScrollButtonsPosition
member.summary: The position of the scroll buttons with regards to the tab band.
member.remarks: This property is applicable when the ScrollChildren property is set to true; otherwise it is ignored.
member.value: One of the TabStripScrollButtonsPosition enumeration values. The default value is Right.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.ScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the scrollable band of tabs relative to the beginning of the scrolling area.
member.remarks: This property is applicable when the ScrollChildren property is set to true; otherwise it is ignored.
member.value: An integer specifying the initial scrolling position (measured in pixels). The default value is 0 (no offset from the default scrolling position). Use negative values to move the tabs to the left.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.PerTabScrolling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tabstrip should scroll directly to the next tab.
member.value: true if the tabstrip should scroll to the next (or previous) tab; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: By default tabs are scrolled smoothly. If you want the tabstrip to scroll directly to the next (or previous) tab set this property to true. This property is applicable when the ScrollChildren property is set to true; otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.SelectedIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the selected child tab.
member.value: The zero based index of the selected tab. The default value is -1 (no child tab is selected).
member.remarks: Use the SelectedIndex property to programmatically specify the selected child tab in a IRadTabContainer (RadTabStrip or RadTab). To clear the selection set the SelectedIndex property to -1.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.SelectedTab
member.summary: Gets the selected child tab.
member.value: Returns the child tab which is currently selected. If no tab is selected (the SelectedIndex property is -1) the SelectedTab property will return null (Nothing in VB.NET).

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.Owner
member.summary: Gets the IRadTabContainer instance which contains the current tab.
member.value: The object which contains the tab. It might be an instance of the RadTabStrip class or the RadTab class depending on the hierarchy level.
member.remarks: The value is of the IRadTabContainer type which is implemented by the RadTabStrip class and the RadTab class. Use the Owner property when recursively traversing tabs in the RadTabStrip control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.Tabs
member.summary: Gets a RadTabCollection object that contains the child tabs of the current tab.
member.value: A RadTabCollection that contains the child tabs of the current tab. By default the collection is empty (the tab has no children).
member.remarks: Use the Tabs property to access the child tabs of the current tab. You can also use the Tabs property to manage the children of the current tab. You can add, remove or modify tabs from the Tabs collection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.SelectedCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the tab is selected.
member.value: The CSS class applied when the tab is selected. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of selected tabs is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the SelectedCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the current tab when it is selected.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.DisabledCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the tab is disabled.
member.value: The CSS class applied when the tab is disabled. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of disabled tabs is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the DisabledCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the tab when it is disabled.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.HoveredCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the tab is hovered with the mouse.
member.value: The CSS class applied when the tab is hovered. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of hovered tabs is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the HoveredCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the tab when it is hovered.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.ChildGroupCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied to the HTML element containing the child tabs.
member.value: The CSS class applied to the child tabs container. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: Tabs are rendered as LI (list item) HTML elements inside a UL (unordered list). The CSS class specified by the ChildGroupCssClass property is applied to the UL tag.
member.example:
ASPX: HTML:
  • News
    • CNN
    • NBC

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.IsBreak
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether next tab will be displayed on a new line.
member.value: true if the next tab should be displayed on a new line; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Use the IsBreak property to create multi-row tabstrip. All tabs after the "break" tab will be displayed on a new line.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.PageViewID
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the RadPageView in a RadMultiPage that will be switched when the tab is selected.
member.remarks: This property overrides the default relation between the page views within a RadMultiPage and the tabs in a RadTabStrip. By default a tab activates the page view with the same index.
member.value: The ID of the RadPageView that will be activated when the tab is selected. The default value is empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed for the current tab.
member.value: The text displayed for the tab in the RadTabStrip control. The default is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the Text property to specify or determine the text that is displayed for the tab in the RadTabStrip control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets custom (user-defined) data associated with the current tab.
member.value: A string representing the user-defined data. The default value is emptry string.
member.remarks: Use the Value property to associate custom data with a RadTab object.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.NavigateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to navigate to when the current tab is clicked.
member.value: The URL to navigate to when the tab is clicked. The default value is empty string which means that clicking the current tab will not navigate.

remarks.para: By default clicking a tab will select it. If the tab has any child tabs they will be displayed. To make a tab navigate to some designated URL you can use the NavigateUrl property. You can optionally set the Target property to specify the window or frame in which to display the linked content.
Setting the NavigateUrl property will disable tab selection and as a result the TabClick event won't be raised for the current tab.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image which is displayed next to the text of a tab.
member.value: The URL to the image to display for the tab. The default value is empty string which means by default no image is displayed.
member.remarks: Use the ImageUrl property to specify a custom image that will be displayed before the text of the current tab.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to specify the image to display for the tab using the ImageUrl property.

<telerik:RadTabStrip id="RadTabStrip1" runat="server">
<Tabs>
<telerik:RadTabImageUrl="~/Img/inbox.gif" Text="Index"></telerik:RadTab>
<telerik:RadTabImageUrl="~/Img/outbox.gif" Text="Outbox"></telerik:RadTab>
<telerik:RadTabImageUrl="~/Img/trash.gif" Text="Trash"></telerik:RadTab>
<telerik:RadTabImageUrl="~/Img/meetings.gif" Text="Meetings"></telerik:RadTab>
</Tabs>
</telerik:RadTabStrip>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.HoveredImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image which is displayed when the user hovers the current tab with the mouse.
member.value: The URL to the image to display for the tab when the user hovers it with the mouse. The default value is empty string which means the image specified via ImageUrl will be used.

remarks.para: Use the HoveredImageUrl property to specify a custom image that will be displayed when the user hovers the tab with the mouse. Setting the HoveredImageUrl property required the ImageUrl property to be set beforehand.
If the HoveredImageUrl property is not set the value of the ImageUrl will be used instead.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.SelectedImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image which is displayed when the tab is selected.
member.value: The URL to the image to display when the tab is selected. The default value is empty string which means the image specified via ImageUrl will be used.

remarks.para: Use the SelectedImageUrl property to specify a custom image that will be displayed when the current tab is selected. Setting the SelectedImageUrl property required the ImageUrl property to be set beforehand.
If the SelectedImageUrl property is not set the value of the ImageUrl will be used instead.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.DisabledImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to an image which is displayed when the tab is disabled (its Enabled property is set to false).
member.value: The URL to the image to display when the tab is disabled. The default value is empty string which means the image specified via ImageUrl will be used.

remarks.para: Use the DisabledImageUrl property to specify a custom image that will be displayed when the current tab is disabled. Setting the DisabledImageUrl property required the ImageUrl property to be set beforehand.
If the DisabledImageUrl property is not set the value of the ImageUrl will be used instead.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target window or frame in which to display the Web page content associated with the current tab.
member.value:
The target window or frame to load the Web page linked to when the tab is selected. Values must begin with a letter in the range of a through z (case insensitive), except for the following special values, which begin with an underscore:
_blank Renders the content in a new window without frames.
_parent Renders the content in the immediate frameset parent.
_self Renders the content in the frame with focus.
_top Renders the content in the full window without frames.
The default value is empty string which means the linked resource will be loaded in the current window.

remarks.para: Use the Target property to target window or frame in which to display the Web page content associated with the current tab. The Web page is specified by the NavigateUrl property.
If this property is not set, the Web page specified by the NavigateUrl property is loaded in the current window.
The Target property is taken into consideration only when the NavigateUrl property is set.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the Target property
<telerik:RadTabStrip id="RadTabStrip1" runat="server">
<Tabs>
<telerik:RadTab Text="News" NavigateUrl="~/News.aspx" Target="_self" />
<telerik:RadTab Text="External URL" NavigateUrl="http://www.example.com" Target="_blank" />
</Tabs>
</telerik:RadTabStrip>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTab.PageView
member.summary: Gets the RadPageView activated when the tab is selected.
member.value: The RadPageView that is activated when the tab is selected. The default value is null (Nothing in VB.NET).

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTabCollection
member.summary: A collection of RadTab objects in a RadTabStrip control.
member.remarks:
The RadTabCollection class represents a collection of RadTab objects.
Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single RadTab from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of menu items in the collection.
Use the Add method to add tabs in the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove tabs from the collection.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton
member.summary: Represents a single button in the RadToolBar class.

remarks.para: When the user clicks a toolbar button, the RadToolBar control can either navigate to a linked Web page or simply post back to the server. If the NavigateUrl property of a toolbar button is set, the RadToolBar control navigates to the linked page. By default, a linked page is displayed in the same window or frame as the RadToolBar control. To display the linked content in a different window or frame, use the Target property.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarItem
member.summary: Represents a single item in the RadToolBar class.

remarks.para: The RadToolBar control is made up of a list of toolbar items represented by RadToolBarItem objects (RadToolBarButton, RadToolBarDropDown, RadToolBarSplitButton). All toolbar items are stored in the Items collection of the toolbar. You can access the toolbar to which the item belongs by using the ToolBar property.
To create the toolbar items for a RadToolBar control, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to create static toolbar items.

Use a constructor to dynamically create new instances of either toolbar item classes (RadToolBarButton, RadToolBarDropDown, RadToolBarSplitButton). These RadToolBarItem objects can then be added to the Items collection of the RadToolBar.
Bind the RadToolBar control to a data source.

remarks.para: Each toolbar item has a Text property. The Button items (RadToolBarButton and RadToolBarSplitButton) have a Value property. The value of the Text property is displayed in the RadToolBar control, while the Value property is used to store any additional data about the toolbar item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarItem.ToolBar
member.summary: Gets the RadToolBar instance which contains the item.
member.remarks: Use this property to obtain an instance to the RadToolBar object containing the item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarItem.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed for the current item.
member.value: The text an item in the RadToolBar control displays. The default is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the Text property to specify or determine the text an item displays displays in the RadToolBar control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarItem.ImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to an image to display for the item.
member.value: The path to the image to display for the item. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the ImageUrl property to specify the image for the item. If the ImageUrl property is set to empty string no image will be rendered. Use "~" (tilde) when referring to images within the current ASP.NET application.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to specify the image to display for a button using the ImageUrl property.

para.para:
<telerik:RadToolBar id="RadToolBar1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/Img/inbox.gif" Text="Index" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/Img/outbox.gif" Text="Outbox" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadToolBar>

member.remarks: Use the HoveredImageUrl property to specify the image that will be used when the user moves the mouse over the item. If the HoveredImageUrl property is set to empty string the image specified by the ImageUrl property will be used. Use "~" (tilde) when referring to images within the current ASP.NET application.

member.value: The path to the image to display when the user clicks the item. The default value is empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarItem.FocusedCssClass

member.value: The CSS class applied when the toolBar item is focused. The default value is String.Empty.

example.para:
<style type="text/css">
            	.myFocusedCssClass .rtbText
            	{

            	}

            	<telerik:RadToolBar id="RadToolBar1" runat="server">

                <Items>

                <telerik:RadToolBarButton
                FocusedCssClass="myFocusedCssClass" Text="Bold" />

                </Items>

                </telerik:RadToolBar>

member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of focused toolBar items is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the FocusedCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the toolBar item when it is focused.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarItem.FocusedImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to an image to display when the user focuses the item either by tabbing to it or by using the AccessKey
member.value: The path to the image to display when the user user focuses the item either by tabbing to that it or by using the AccessKey. The default value is empty string.
member.remarks: Use the FocusedImageUrl property to specify the image that will be used when the item gets the focus after tabbing or using its AccessKey. If the FocusedImageUrl property is set to empty string the image specified by the ImageUrl property will be used. Use "~" (tilde) when referring to images within the current ASP.NET application.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarItem.ImagePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the item image according to the item text.
member.value: The position of the item image according to the item text. The default value is ToolBarImagePosition.Left.

member.summary: For internal use only

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadToolBarButton class.
