member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadToolBarButton class with the specified text data.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadToolBarButton class using the specified text.

member.param: The text of the button. The Text property is set to the value of this parameter.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadToolBarButton class with the specified text, checked state and group name data.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadToolBarButton class using the specified text, checked state and group name.
When this constructor used, the CheckOnClick property of the created RadToolBarButton is automatically set to true.

member.param: The text of the button. The Text property is set to the value of this parameter.
The checked state of the button. The Checked property is set to the value of this parameter.
The group to which the button belongs. The Group property is set to the value of this parameter.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.Clone
member.summary: Creates a copy of the current RadToolBarButton object.
member.returns: A RadToolBarButton which is a copy of the current one.
member.remarks: Use the Clone method to create a copy of the current button. All properties of the clone are set to the same values as the current ones.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.Owner
member.summary: Gets a reference to the owner of the RadToolBarButton.
member.value: The IToolBarItemContainer control (RadToolBar, RadToolBarDropDown, RadToolBarSplitButton) which holds the RadToolBarButton.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.DataItem
member.summary: Gets the data item that is bound to the button
member.value: An Object that represents the data item that is bound to the button. The default value is null (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that the button is not bound to any data item. The return value will always be null unless accessed within a ButtonDataBound event handler.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only during data binding. Use it along with the ButtonDataBound event to perform additional mapping of fields from the data item to RadToolBarButton properties.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.IsSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the button is separator.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.CheckOnClick
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the button has a check state.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.Checked
member.summary: Gets or sets if the button is checked.

remarks.para: The Checked property of the button depends on the CheckOnClick property. If the CheckOnClick property is set to false, the Checked property will be ignored.
When a button's Checked state is set to true, all the buttons that belong to the same group in the RadToolBar get their Checked state set to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.Group
member.summary: Gets or sets the group to which the button belongs.
member.remarks: The Group property of the button depends on the CheckOnClick property. When several buttons in the RadToolBar are assigned to the same group, checking one of them will uncheck the one that is currently checked. If the CheckOnClick property is set to false, the Group property will be ignored.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.CheckedCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the toolbar button is checked.
member.value: The CSS class applied when the toolbar button is checked. The default value is string.Empty.
member.example: By default the visual appearance of clicked toolbar buttons is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the ClickedCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the toolbar button when it is clicked.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.CheckedImageUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to an image to display for the button when its Checked state is "true".
member.value: The path to the image to display when its Checked state is "true". The default value is empty string.

example.para:
<telerik:RadToolBar id="RadToolBar1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/Img/alignLeft.gif" CheckedImageUrl="~/Img/alignLeftChecked.gif" Text="Left" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/Img/alignRight.gif" CheckedImageUrl="~/Img/alignRightChecked.gif" Text="Right" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadToolBar>

member.remarks: Use the CheckedImageUrl property to specify the image that will be used when the button is checked. If the CheckedImageUrl property is set to empty string the image specified by the ImageUrl property will be used. Use "~" (tilde) when referring to images within the current ASP.NET application.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.AllowSelfUnCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if a checked button will get unchecked when clicked.
member.value: If a checked button will get unchecked when clicked. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.ItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the button.

value.para: A ITemplate implemented object that contains the template for displaying the item. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.

example.para: The following template demonstrates how to add a Calendar control in a certain ToolBar button.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.PostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether clicking on the button will postback.
member.value: True if the toolbar button should postback; otherwise false. By default all the items will postback provided the user has subscribed to the ButtonClick event.
member.remarks: If you subscribe to the ButtonClick all toolbar buttons will postback. To turn off that behavior you should set the PostBack property to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the toolbar button.
member.value: The value associated with the button. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the Value property to specify or determine the value associated with the button.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.NavigateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to link to when the button is clicked.
member.value: The URL to link to when the button is clicked. The default value is empty string.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the NavigateUrl property
<telerik:RadToolBar id="RadToolBar1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="News" NavigateUrl="~/News.aspx" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="External URL" NavigateUrl="http://www.example.com" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadToolBar>
member.remarks: Use the NavigateUrl property to specify the URL to link to when the button is clicked. Use "~" (tilde) in front of an URL within the same ASP.NET application. When specifying external URL do not forget the protocol (e.g. "http://").

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target window or frame to display the Web page content linked to when the toolbar button is clicked.
member.value:
The target window or frame to load the Web page linked to when the button is selected. Values must begin with a letter in the range of a through z (case insensitive), except for the following special values, which begin with an underscore:
_blank Renders the content in a new window without frames.
_parent Renders the content in the immediate frameset parent.
_self Renders the content in the frame with focus.
_top Renders the content in the full window without frames.
The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the Target property to specify the frame or window that displays the Web page linked to when the toolbar button is clicked. The Web page is specified by setting the NavigateUrl property.
If this property is not set, the Web page specified by the NavigateUrl property is loaded in the current window.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to use the Target property

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.CommandName
member.summary: Gets or sets the command name associated with the toolbar button that is passed to the ItemCommand event of the RadToolBar instance.
member.value: The command name of the toolbar button. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.CommandArgument
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional parameter passed to the Command event of the RadToolBar instance along with the associated CommandName
member.value: An optional parameter passed to the Command event of the RadToolBar instance along with the associated CommandName. The default value is an empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.CausesValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation is performed when the RadToolBarButton is clicked
member.value: true if validation is performed when the RadToolBarButton is clicked otherwise, false. The default value is true.

remarks.para: By default, page validation is performed when the button is clicked. Page validation determines whether the input controls associated with a validation control on the page all pass the validation rules specified by the validation control. You can specify or determine whether validation is performed when the button is clicked on both the client and the server by using the CausesValidation property. To prevent validation from being performed, set the CausesValidation property to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.ValidationGroup

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the validation group to which the RadToolBarButton belongs.

member.value: The name of the validation group to which this RadToolBarButton belongs. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: This property works only when CausesValidation is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButton.PostBackUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the page to post to from the current page when the RadToolBarButton is clicked.
member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when the RadToolBarButton is clicked. The default value is an empty string (""), which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarSplitButton.EnableDefaultButton
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, indicating if the RadToolBarSplitButton will use the DefaultButton behavior.
member.value: A value, indicating if the RadToolBarSplitButton wll use the DefaultButton behavior. The default value is true

remarks.para: Use the EnableDefaultButton property to set if RadToolBarSplitButton will use the DefaultButton behavior or not. When the DefaultButton behavior is used, the RadToolBarSplitButton properties are ignored and the properties of the last selected button are used instead. Use the EnableDefaultButton property in conjunction with the DefaultButtonIndex property to specify which of the RadToolBarSplitButton child buttons will be used when the RadToolBar is initially displayed.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the EnableDefaultButton property
<telerik:RadToolBar id="RadToolBar1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton EnableDefaultButton="true" DefaultButtonIndex="1"> <Buttons>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/images/red.gif" Text="Red" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/images/green.gif" Text="Green" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/images/blue.gif" Text="Blue" /> </Buttons>
</telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton>/
</Items>
</telerik:RadToolBar>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarSplitButton.DefaultButtonIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the button which properties will be used by default when the EnableDefaultButton property set to true.
member.value: The index of the button which properties will be used by default when the EnableDefaultButton property set to true. The default value is 0
member.remarks: Use the DefaultButtonIndex property to specify the button which properties RadToolBarSplitButton will use when the RadToolBar is initially displayed.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the DefaultButtonIndex property
<telerik:RadToolBar id="RadToolBar1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton EnableDefaultButton="true" DefaultButtonIndex="1"> <Buttons>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/images/red.gif" Text="Red" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/images/green.gif" Text="Green" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/images/blue.gif" Text="Blue" /> </Buttons>
</telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton>/
</Items>
</telerik:RadToolBar>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.ClientChanges
member.summary: Gets a list of all client-side changes (adding an item, removing an item, changing an item's property) which have occurred.
member.value: A list of objects which represent all client-side changes the user has performed. By default the ClientChanges property returns empty list. Client-changes are recorded if and only if the client-side methods trackChanges()/commitChanges() have been invoked.
member.remarks:
You can use the ClientChanges property to respond to client-side modifications such as
adding a new item
removing existing item
clearing the children of an item or the control itself
changing a property of the item
The ClientChanges property is available in the first postback (ajax) request after the client-side modifications have taken place. After this moment the property will return empty list.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.Items
member.summary: Gets a collection of RadToolBarItem objects representing the individual items within the RadToolBar.
member.value: A RadToolBarItemCollection that contains a collection of RadToolBarItem objects representing the individual items within the RadToolBar.
member.remarks: Use the Items collection to programmatically control the items in the RadToolBar control.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to declare a RadToolBar with different items.
<telerik:RadToolBar ID="RadToolBar1" runat="server"> <Items> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/CreateNew.gif" Text="Create new" CommandName="CreateNew"/> <telerik:RadToolBarButton IsSeparator="true" /> <telerik:RadToolBarDropDown ImageUrl="~/ToolbarImages/Manage.gif" Text="Manage"> <Buttons> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolbarImages/ManageUsers.gif" Text="Users" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolbarImages/ManageOrders.gif" Text="Orders" /> </Buttons> </telerik:RadToolBarDropDown> <telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/RegisterPurchase.gif" Text="Register Purchase"> <Buttons> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/RegisterCachePurchase.gif" Text="Cache Purchase" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/RegisterCheckPurchase.gif" Text="Check Purchase" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/RegisterDirectBankPurchase.gif" Text="Bank Purchase" /> </Buttons> </telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton> </Items> </telerik:RadToolBar>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which to render the RadToolBar control.
member.value: One of the Orientation enumeration values. The default is Orientation.Horizontal.
member.remarks:
Use the Orientation property to specify the direction in which to render the RadToolBar control. The following table lists the available directions.
Orientation Description
Orientation.Horizontal The RadToolBar control is rendered horizontally.
Orientation.Vertical The RadToolBar control is rendered vertically.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the Orientation property to display a vertical RadToolBar.
<telerik:RadToolBar ID="RadToolBar1" runat="server"> <Items> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/CreateNew.gif" Text="Create new" CommandName="CreateNew"/> <telerik:RadToolBarButton IsSeparator="true" /> <telerik:RadToolBarDropDown ImageUrl="~/ToolbarImages/Manage.gif" Text="Manage"> <Buttons> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolbarImages/ManageUsers.gif" Text="Users" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolbarImages/ManageOrders.gif" Text="Orders" /> </Buttons> </telerik:RadToolBarDropDown> <telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/RegisterPurchase.gif" Text="Register Purchase"> <Buttons> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/RegisterCachePurchase.gif" Text="Cache Purchase" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/RegisterCheckPurchase.gif" Text="Check Purchase" /> <telerik:RadToolBarButton ImageUrl="~/ToolBarImages/RegisterDirectBankPurchase.gif" Text="Bank Purchase" /> </Buttons> </telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton> </Items> </telerik:RadToolBar>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.ExpandAnimation
member.summary: Gets the settings for the animation played when a dropdown opens.
member.value: An AnnimationSettings that represents the expand animation.

remarks.para:
Use the ExpandAnimation property to customize the expand animation of the RadToolBar dropdown items - RadToolBarDropDown and RadToolBarSplitButton. You can specify the Type and the Duration of the expand animation. To disable expand animation effects you should set the Type to AnimationType.None.
To customize the collapse animation you can use the CollapseAnimation property.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to set the ExpandAnimation of the RadToolBar dropdown items.
ASPX:
<telerik:RadToolBar ID="RadToolBar1" runat="server">
<ExpandAnimation Type="OutQuint" Duration="300" />
<Items>
<telerik:RadToolBarDropDown Text="Insert Html Element" >
<Buttons>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Image" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Editable Div element" />
</Buttons>
</telerik:RadToolBarDropDown>
<telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton Text="Insert Form Element" >
<Buttons>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Button" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="TextBox" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="TextArea" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="CheckBox" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="RadioButton" />
</Buttons>
</telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton>
</Items>
</telerik:RadToolBar>
void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e) { RadToolBar1.ExpandAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear; RadToolBar1.ExpandAnimation.Duration = 300; }
Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load RadToolBar1.ExpandAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear RadToolBar1.ExpandAnimation.Duration = 300 End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.CollapseAnimation
member.summary: Gets the settings for the animation played when a dropdown closes.
member.value: An AnnimationSettings that represents the collapse animation.

remarks.para:
Use the CollapseAnimation property to customize the collapse animation of the RadToolBar dropdown items - RadToolBarDropDown and RadToolBarSplitButton. You can specify the Type and the Duration of the collapse animation. To disable collapse animation effects you should set the Type to AnimationType.None.
To customize the expand animation you can use the ExpandAnimation property.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to set the CollapseAnimation of the RadToolBar dropdown items.
ASPX:
<telerik:RadToolBar ID="RadToolBar1" runat="server">
<CollapseAnimation Type="OutQuint" Duration="300" />
<Items>
<telerik:RadToolBarDropDown Text="Insert Html Element" >
<Buttons>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Image" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Editable Div element" />
</Buttons>
</telerik:RadToolBarDropDown>
<telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton Text="Insert Form Element" >
<Buttons>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Button" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="TextBox" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="TextArea" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="CheckBox" />
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="RadioButton" />
</Buttons>
</telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton>
</Items>
</telerik:RadToolBar>
void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e) { RadToolBar1.CollapseAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear; RadToolBar1.CollapseAnimation.Duration = 300; }
Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load RadToolBar1.CollapseAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear RadToolBar1.CollapseAnimation.Duration = 300 End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.ValidationGroup

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs.

member.value: The name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: This property works only when CausesValidation is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.PostBackUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of the page to post to from the current page when a button item from the RadToolBar control is clicked.
member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip control is clicked. The default value is an empty string (""), which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.CausesValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation is performed when a button item within the RadToolBar control is clicked.
member.value: true if validation is performed when a button item is clicked; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

remarks.para: By default, page validation is performed when a button item is clicked. Page validation determines whether the input controls associated with a validation control on the page all pass the validation rules specified by the validation control. You can specify or determine whether validation is performed on both the client and the server when a tab is clicked by using the CausesValidation property. To prevent validation from being performed, set the CausesValidation property to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.AutoPostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether button items should postback when clicked.
member.value: True if button items should postback; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks:
RadToolBar will postback provided one of the following conditions is met:
The AutoPostBack property is set to true.
The user has subscribed to the ButtonClick event.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the javascript function called when the control is fully initialized on the client side.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the javascript function called when the control is fully initialized on the client side. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientLoad property to specify a JavaScript function that is executed after the control is initialized on the client side. A single parameter is passed to the handler, which is the client-side RadToolBar object.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the OnClientLoad property.
<script language="javascript">
function onClientToolBarLoad(toolBar, eventArgs)
{
alert(toolBar.get_id() + " is loaded.");
}
</script>
<telerik:RadToolBar id="RadToolBar1" runat="server" OnClientButtonClicking="onButtonClicking">
<Items>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Save"></telerik:RadToolBarButton>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Load"></telerik:RadToolBarButton>
<telerik:RadToolBarDropDown Text="Align">
<Buttons>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Left"></telerik:RadToolBarButton>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Center"></telerik:RadToolBarButton>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Right"></telerik:RadToolBarButton>
</Buttons>
</telerik:RadToolBarDropDown>
<telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton Text="Apply Color (Red)">
<Buttons>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Red"></telerik:RadToolBarButton>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Yellow"></telerik:RadToolBarButton>
<telerik:RadToolBarButton Text="Blue"></telerik:RadToolBarButton>
</Buttons>
</telerik:RadToolBarSplitButton>
</Items>
</telerik:RadToolBar>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientButtonClicking
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called just prior to clicking a toolbar button item (RadToolBarButton or RadToolBarSplitButton).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para:
Use the OnClientButtonClicking property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed prior to button item clicking - either by left-clicking it with the mouse or hitting enter after tabbing to that button. You can cancel that event (prevent button clicking) by seting the cancel property of the event argument to true.
Two parameters are passed to the handler
sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)
eventArgs with three properties
item - the instance of the button item being clicked
cancel - whether to cancel the event
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientButtonClicked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called after clicking a button item (RadToolBarButton or RadToolBarSplitButton).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientButtonClicked property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed after a button is clicked - either by left-clicking it with the mouse or hitting enter after tabbing to that button item.
Two parameters are passed to the handler

list.item: sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)

eventArgs with two properties
item - the instance of the clicked button
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the OnClientButtonClicked property.
<script language="javascript">
function clientButtonClicked(sender, eventArgs)
{
var toolBar = sender;
var button = eventArgs.get_item();
alert(String.format("You clicked the '{0}' button in the '{1}' toolBar.", button.get_text(), toolBar.get_id()));
}
</script> <telerik:RadToolBar id="RadToolBar1" runat="server" OnClientButtonClicked="clientButtonClicked">

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientDropDownOpening
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called just prior to opening a toolbar dropdown item (RadToolBarDropDown or RadToolBarSplitButton).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para:
Use the OnClientDropDownOpening property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed prior to dropdown item opening - either by left-clicking it with the mouse or hitting the down arrow after tabbing to that item. You can cancel that event (prevent dropdown opening) by seting the cancel property of the event argument to true.
Two parameters are passed to the handler
sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)
eventArgs with three properties
item - the instance of the dropdown item being opened
cancel - whether to cancel the event
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event (null if the event was initiated by calling a client-side method such as dropDownItem.showDropDown();)

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientDropDownOpened
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called after a toolbar dropdown item (RadToolBarDropDown or RadToolBarSplitButton) is opened.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para:
Use the OnClientDropDownOpened property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed after a toolbar dropdown item is opened - either by left-clicking it with the mouse or hitting the down arrow after tabbing to that item.
Two parameters are passed to the handler
sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)
eventArgs with two properties
item - the instance of the dropdown item which is opened
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event (null if the event was initiated by calling a client-side method such as dropDownItem.showDropDown())

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the OnClientDropDownOpened property.
<script language="javascript">
function clientDropDownOpened(sender, eventArgs)
{
var toolBar = sender;
var dropDownItem = eventArgs.get_item();
alert("You just opened the '" + dropDownItem.get_text() + "' dropDown in the '" + toolBar.get_id() + "' toolBar.");
}
</script>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientDropDownClosing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called just prior to closing a toolbar dropdown item (RadToolBarDropDown or RadToolBarSplitButton).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para:
Use the OnClientDropDownClosing property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed prior to dropdown item closing - either by left-clicking an open dropdown with the mouse, hitting the ESC key when the dropdown or a button in it is focused, or clicking a non-checkable button in the dropdown. You can cancel that event (prevent dropdown closing) by seting the cancel property of the event argument to true.
Two parameters are passed to the handler
sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)
eventArgs with three properties
item - the instance of the dropdown item being closed
cancel - whether to cancel the event
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event (null if the event was initiated by calling a client-side method such as dropDownItem.hideDropDown())

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientDropDownClosed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called after a toolbar dropdown item (RadToolBarDropDown or RadToolBarSplitButton) is closed.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para:
Use the OnClientDropDownClosed property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed after a toolbar dropdown item is closed - either by left-clicking an open dropdown with the mouse, hitting the ESC key when the dropdown or a button in it is focused, or clicking a non-checkable button in the dropdown.
Two parameters are passed to the handler
sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)
eventArgs with two properties
item - the instance of the dropdown item which is closed
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event (null if the event was initiated by calling a client-side method such as dropDownItem.hideDropDown())

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the OnClientDropDownClosed property.
<script language="javascript">
function clientDropDownClosed(sender, eventArgs)
{
var toolBar = sender;
var dropDownItem = eventArgs.get_item();
alert("You just closed the '" + dropDownItem.get_text() + "' dropDown in the '" + toolBar.get_id() + "' toolBar.");
}
</script>

member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientContextMenu property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed before the context menu shows after right clicking an item.
Two parameters are passed to the handler

list.item: sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)

eventArgs with two properties
item - the instance of the selected toolbar item
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientMouseOver
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when the mouse hovers an item in the RadToolBar control.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientMouseOver property to specify a JavaScript function that is called when the user hovers an item with the mouse.
Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender (the client-side RadToolBar object);

eventArgs with two properties
item - the instance of the toolbar item that is being hovered
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientMouseOut
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when the mouse leaves an item in the RadToolBar control.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientMouseOut property to specify a JavaScript function that is executed whenever the user moves the mouse away from a particular item in the RadToolBar control.

para.font: Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender (the client-side RadToolBar object);

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientCheckedStateChanging
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called just prior to changing the state of a checkable RadToolBarButton.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para:
Use the OnClientCheckedStateChanging property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed prior to button checked state changing - either by left-clicking a checkable button or pressing the ENTER key after tabbing to that button. You can cancel that event (prevent button checked state changing) by seting the cancel property of the event argument to true.
Two parameters are passed to the handler
sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)
eventArgs with three properties
item - the instance of the button which checked state is being changed
cancel - whether to cancel the event
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event (null if the event was initiated by calling a client-side method such as button.toggle())

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.OnClientCheckedStateChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called after a RadToolBarButton is checked.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para:
Use the OnClientCheckedStateChanged property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed after a toolbar dropdown button is checked - either by left-clicking a checkable button or pressing the ENTER key after tabbing to that button.
Two parameters are passed to the handler
sender (the client-side RadToolBar object)
eventArgs with two properties
item - the instance of the button which is checked
domEvent - the reference to the browser DOM event (null if the event was initiated by calling a client-side method such as button.toggle())

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the OnClientCheckedStateChanged property.
<script language="javascript">
function clientCheckedStateChanged(sender, eventArgs)
{
var toolBar = sender;
var button = eventArgs.get_item();
alert(String.format("You just changed the checked state of the '{0}' button in the '{1}' toolBar.", button.get_text(), toolBar.get_id()));
}
</script>

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.ItemCreated
member.summary: Occurs when a toolbar item is created.
member.remarks:
The ItemCreated event is raised when an item in the RadToolBar control is created, both during round-trips and at the time data is bound to the control. The ItemCreated event is not raised for items which are defined inline in the page or user control.
The ItemCreated event is commonly used to initialize item properties.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBar.ButtonDataBound
member.summary: Occurs when a button is data bound.

remarks.para: The ButtonDataBound event is raised for each button upon databinding. You can retrieve the button being bound using the event arguments. The DataItem associated with the button can be retrieved using the DataItem property.
The ButtonDataBound event is often used in scenarios when you want to perform additional mapping of fields from the DataItem to their respective properties in the RadToolBarButton class.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar
member.summary: A navigation control used for building collapsible side-menu systems and Outlook-type panels.

remarks.para: The RadPanelBar control is used to display a list of items in a Web Forms page and is often used control for building collapsible side-menu interfaces. The RadPanelBar control supports the following features:

list.item: Databinding that allows the control to be populated from various datasources
Programmatic access to the RadPanelBar object model which allows to dynamic creation of panelbars, populate items, set properties.
Customizable appearance through built-in or user-defined skins.

remarks.para: The RadPanelBar control is made up of tree of items represented by RadPanelItem objects. Items at the first level (level 0) are called root items. A items that has a parent item is called a child item. All root items are stored in the Items collection. Child items are stored in a parent item's Items collection.

Each item has a Text and a Value property. The value of the Text property is displayed in the RadPanelBar control, while the Value property is used to store any additional data about the item, such as data passed to the postback event associated with the item. When clicked, a item can navigate to another Web page indicated by the NavigateUrl property.

member.remarks: Use this property to retrieve the child items. You can also use it to programmatically add or remove items.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.ClientChanges
member.summary: Gets a list of all client-side changes (adding an item, removing an item, changing an item's property) which have occurred.
member.value: A list of objects which represent all client-side changes the user has performed. By default the ClientChanges property returns empty list. Client-changes are recorded if and only if the client-side methods trackChanges()/commitChanges() have been invoked.
member.remarks:
You can use the ClientChanges property to respond to client-side modifications such as
adding a new item
removing existing item
clearing the children of an item or the control itself
changing a property of the item
The ClientChanges property is available in the first postback (ajax) request after the client-side modifications have taken place. After this moment the property will return empty list.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.Items
member.summary: Gets a RadPanelItemCollection object that contains the root items of the current RadPanelBar control.
member.value: A RadPanelItemCollection that contains the root items of the current RadPanelBar control. By default the collection is empty (RadPanelBar has no children).
member.remarks: Use the Items property to access the child items of RadPanelBar. You can also use the Items property to manage the root items. You can add, remove or modify items from the Items collection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.SelectedItem
member.summary: Gets the selected panel item.
member.value: Returns the panel item which is currently selected. If no item is selected the SelectedItem property will return null (Nothing in VB.NET).

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.ItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the items in RadPanelBar.

value.para: A ITemplate implemented object that contains the template for displaying panel items. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.
The ItemTemplate property sets a template that will be used for all panel items.
To specify unique display for individual items use the ItemTemplate property of the RadPanelItem class.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to use the ItemTemplate property to add a CheckBox for each item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.ExpandMode
member.summary: Gets of sets a value indicating the behavior of RadPanelbar when an item is expanded.
member.value: One of the PanelBarExpandMode Enumeration values. The default value is MultipleExpandedItems.

remarks.para: Use the ExpandMode property to specify the way RadPanelbar should behave after an item is expanded. The available options are:

list.item: MultipleExpandedItems (default) - More than one item can be expanded at a time.
SingleExpandedItem - Only one item can be expanded at a time. Expanding another item collapses the previously expanded one.

FullExpandedItem - Only one item can be expanded at a time. The expanded area occupies the entire height of the RadPanelbar. The Height property should be set in order RadPanelbar to operate correctly in this mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.AllowCollapseAllItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all items can be collapsed. This allows all the items to be collapsed even if the panelbar's ExpandMode is set to SingleExpandedItem or FullExpandedItem mode.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.PostBackUrl

summary.para: Gets or sets the URL of the page to post to from the current page when an item from the panel is clicked.

member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when an item from the panel control is clicked. The default value is an empty string (""), which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.MaxDataBindDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of levels to bind to the RadPanelBar control.
member.value: The maximum number of levels to bind to the RadPanelBar control. The default is -1, which binds all the levels in the data source to the control.
member.remarks: When binding the RadPanelBar control to a data source, use the MaxDataBindDepth property to limit the number of levels to bind to the control. For example, setting this property to 2 binds only the root panel items and their immediate children. All remaining records in the data source are ignored.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.PersistStateInCookie
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control would persists its state between pages (expanded and selected items).
member.value: true if the control would persist its state; false otherwise. The default value is false.

remarks.para: Use the PersistStateInCookie property to make RadPanelbar persist its state between pages. This feature requires browser cookies to be enabled. Also the ClientID and ID properties of the RadPanelbar control must be the same in all pages accessible via the control (and containing it).
Page1.aspx:
<radP:RadPanelbar ID="RadPanelbar1" > ... </radP:RadPanelbar>
Page2.aspx
<radP:RadPanelbar ID="RadPanelbar1" > ... </radP:RadPanelbar>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.CookieName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the cookie which should be used when PersistStateInCookie is set to true.
member.remarks: If this property is not set the ClientID property will be used as the name of the cookie.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.ExpandAnimation
member.summary: Gets the settings for the animation played when an item opens.
member.value: An AnnimationSettings that represents the expand animation.

remarks.para:
Use the ExpandAnimation property to customize the expand animation of RadPanelBar. You can specify the Type, Duration and the To disable expand animation effects you should set the Type to AnimationType.None.
To customize the collapse animation you can use the CollapseAnimation property.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to set the ExpandAnimation of RadPanelBar.
ASPX:
<telerik:RadPanelBar ID="RadPanelBar1" runat="server">
<ExpandAnimation Type="OutQuint" Duration="300" />
<Items>
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="News" >
<Items>
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="CNN" NavigateUrl="http://www.cnn.com" />
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="Google News" NavigateUrl="http://news.google.com" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadPanelBarItem>
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="Sport" >
<Items>
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="ESPN" NavigateUrl="http://www.espn.com" />
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="Eurosport" NavigateUrl="http://www.eurosport.com" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadPanelBarItem>
</Items>
</telerik:RadPanelBar>
void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e) { RadPanelBar1.ExpandAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear; RadPanelBar1.ExpandAnimation.Duration = 300; }
Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load RadPanelBar1.ExpandAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear RadPanelBar1.ExpandAnimation.Duration = 300 End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.ExpandDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the timeout after which a panel item starts to open.
member.value: An integer specifying the timeout measured in milliseconds. The default value is 100 milliseconds.

remarks.para: Use the ExpandDelay property to delay item opening.
To customize the timeout prior to item closing use the CollapseDelay property.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to specify a half second (500 milliseconds) timeout prior to item opening:

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.CollapseAnimation
member.summary: Gets the settings for the animation played when an item closes.
member.value: An AnnimationSettings that represents the collapse animation.

remarks.para:
Use the CollapseAnimation property to customize the expand animation of RadPanelBar. You can specify the Type, Duration and the items are collapsed.
To disable expand animation effects you should set the Type to AnimationType.None. To customize the expand animation you can use the ExpandAnimation property.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to set the CollapseAnimation of RadPanelBar.
ASPX:
<telerik:RadPanelBar ID="RadPanelBar1" runat="server">
<CollapseAnimation Type="OutQuint" Duration="300" />
<Items>
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="News" >
<Items>
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="CNN" NavigateUrl="http://www.cnn.com" />
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="Google News" NavigateUrl="http://news.google.com" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadPanelBarItem>
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="Sport" >
<Items>
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="ESPN" NavigateUrl="http://www.espn.com" />
<telerik:RadPanelBarItem Text="Eurosport" NavigateUrl="http://www.eurosport.com" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadPanelBarItem>
</Items>
</telerik:RadPanelBar>
void Page_Load(object sender, EventArgs e) { RadPanelBar1.CollapseAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear; RadPanelBar1.CollapseAnimation.Duration = 300; }
Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load RadPanelBar1.CollapseAnimation.Type = AnimationType.Linear RadPanelBar1.CollapseAnimation.Duration = 300 End Sub

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.CollapseDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the timeout after which a panel item starts to close.
member.value: An integer specifying the timeout measured in milliseconds. The default value is 500 (half a second).

remarks.para: Use the CollapseDelay property to delay item closing. To cause immediate item closing set this property to 0 (zero).
To customize the timeout prior to item closing use the ExpandDelay property.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to specify one second (1000 milliseconds) timeout prior to item closing:

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.ItemCreated
member.summary: Occurs on the server when an item in the RadPanelBar control is created.

remarks.para: The ItemCreated event is raised every time a new item is added.
The ItemCreated event is not related to data binding and you cannot retrieve the DataItem of the item in the event handler.
The ItemCreated event is often useful in scenarios where you want to initialize all items - for example setting the ToolTip of each RadPanelBarItem to be equal to the Text property.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.ItemClick
member.summary: Occurs on the server when a panel item in the RadPanelBar control is clicked.

remarks.para: The panel will also postback if you navigate to a panel item using the [panel item] key and then press [enter] on the panel item that is focused. The instance of the clicked panel item is passed to the ItemClick event handler - you can obtain a reference to it using the eventArgs.RadPanelBarItem property.

member.name: E:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.ItemDataBound
member.summary: Occurs after a panel item is data bound.

remarks.para: The ItemDataBound event is raised for each panel item upon databinding. You can retrieve the item being bound using the event arguments. The DataItem associated with the item can be retrieved using the DataItem property.
The ItemDataBound event is often used in scenarios when you want to perform additional mapping of fields from the DataItem to their respective properties in the RadPanelBarItem class.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.OnClientContextMenu
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called before the browser context panel shows (after right-clicking an item).
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the OnClientContextMenu property to specify a JavaScript function that will be executed before the context menu shows after right clicking an item.
Two parameters are passed to the handler

list.item: sender (the client-side RadPanelbar object)

eventArgs with two properties
Item - the instance of the selected item
EventObject - the browser DOM event

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.OnClientItemClicking

remarks.para: This event is similar to OnClientItemFocus but fires only on mouse click.
If specified, the OnClientItemClicking client-side event handler is called before a panel item is clicked upon. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the panelbar client object;
eventArgs with one property, Item (the instance of the panel item).

remarks.para: The OnClientItemClicking event can be cancelled. To do so, return False from the event handler.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when a panel item is clicked.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.OnClientItemClicked
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called after a panel item is clicked.

remarks.para: This event is similar to OnClientItemFocus but fires only on mouse click.
If specified, the OnClientItemClicked client-side event handler is called after a panel item is clicked upon. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the panelbar client object;
eventArgs with one property, Item (the instance of the panel item).

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.example:
<script type="text/javascript">

            function OnClientItemClickedHandler(sender, eventArgs)

            {

            alert(eventArgs.Item.Text);

            }

            </script>

            <radP:RadPanelbar ID="RadPanelbar1"

            runat="server"

            	OnClientItemClicked="OnClientItemClickedHandler">

            ....

            </radP:RadPanelbar>
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.OnClientItemFocus
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when a panel item gets focus.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: If specified, the OnClientItemFocus client-side event handler is called when a panel item is selected using either the keyboard (the [TAB] or arrow keys) or by clicking it. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the panelbar client object;
eventArgs with one property, Item (the instance of the panel item).

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.OnClientItemBlur
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called after an item loses focus.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: If specified, the OnClientItemBlur client-side event handler is called when a panel item loses focus as a result of the user pressing a key or clicking elsewhere on the page. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the panelbar client object;
eventArgs with one property, Item (the instance of the panel item).

remarks.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelBar.OnClientItemExpand
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the client-side event handler that is called when a group of child items expands.
member.value: A string specifying the name of the JavaScript function that will handle the event. The default value is empty string.

requirements.para: If specified, the OnClientItemOpen client-side event handler is called when a group of child items opens. Two parameters are passed to the handler:

list.item: sender, the panelbar client object;
eventArgs with one property, Item (the instance of the panel item).

requirements.para: This event cannot be cancelled.

eventArgs with one property, Item (the instance of the panel item).

remarks.para: If specified, the OnClienLoad client-side event handler is called after the panelbar is fully initialized on the client.

This event cannot be cancelled.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem
member.summary: Represents a item in the RadPanelBar control.

remarks.para: The RadPanelBar control is made up of items. Items which are immediate children of the panelbar are root items. Items which are children of root items are child items.

A item usually stores data in two properties, the Text property and the Value property. The value of the Text property is displayed in the RadPanelBar control, and the Value property is used to store additional data.
To create panel items, use one of the following methods:

list.item: Use declarative syntax to define items inline in your page or user control.
Use one of the constructors to dynamically create new instances of the RadPanelItem class. These items can then be added to the Items collection of another item or panelbar.
Data bind the RadPanelBar control to a data source.

remarks.para: When the user clicks a panel item, the RadPanelBar control can navigate to a linked Web page, post back to the server or select that item. If the NavigateUrl property of a item is set, the RadPanelBar control navigates to the linked page. By default, a linked page is displayed in the same window or frame. To display the linked content in a different window or frame, use the Target property.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadPanelItem class.
member.remarks: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadPanelItem class using default values.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadPanelItem class with the specified text data.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadPanelItem class using the specified text.

member.param: The text of the item. The Text property is set to the value of this parameter.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.ExpandParentItems
member.summary: Expands all parent items so the item is visible.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadPanelItem class with the specified text and URL to navigate to.

remarks.para: Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the RadPanelItem class using the specified text and URL.

member.param: The text of the item. The Text property is set to the value of this parameter.
The url which the item will navigate to. The NavigateUrl property is set to the value of this parameter.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.ImagePosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the position of the image within the item.
member.value: One of the RadPanelItemImagePosition Enumeration values. The default value is Left.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.PanelBar
member.summary: Gets the RadPanelBar instance which contains the item.
member.remarks: Use this property to obtain an instance to the RadPanelBar object containing the item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.Owner
member.summary: Gets the IRadPanelItemContainer instance which contains the current item.
member.value: The object which contains the item. It might be an instance of the RadPanelBar class or the RadPanelItem class depending on the hierarchy level.
member.remarks: The value is of the IRadPanelItemContainer type which is implemented by the RadPanelBar class and the RadPanelItem class. Use the Owner property when recursively traversing items in the RadPanelBar control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.IsSeparator
member.summary: Sets or gets whether the item is separator. It also represents a logical state of the item. Might be used in some applications for keyboard navigation to omit processing items that are marked as separators.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the panel item is expanded.
member.value: true if the panel item is expanded; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.Level
member.summary: Manages the item level of a particular Item instance. This property allows easy implementation/separation of the panel items in levels.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.ChildGroupHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the child item group.
member.value: A Unit that represents the height of the child item group. The default value is Empty.
member.remarks: If the total child group height exceeds the value specified with the ChildGroupHeight property scrolling will be applied.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.ChildGroupCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied to the element enclosing the child items.
member.value: The default value is empry string.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.DisabledCssClass
member.summary: Gets or sets the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class applied when the panel item is disabled.
member.value: The CSS class applied when the panel item is disabled. The default value is "disabled".
member.remarks: By default the visual appearance of disabled panel items is defined in the skin CSS file. You can use the DisabledCssClass property to specify unique appearance for the panel item when it is disabled.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.PostBack
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether clicking on the item will postback.
member.value: True if the panel item should postback; otherwise false. By default all the items will postback provided the user has subscribed to the ItemClick event.
member.remarks: If you subscribe to the ItemClick all panel items will postback. To turn off that behavior you should set the PostBack property to false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.PreventCollapse
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether clicking on the item will collapse it.
member.value: False if the panel item should collapse; otherwise True.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.Selected
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is selected.

value.para: true if the item is selected; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.value: true if the item is selected; otherwise false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Use the Selected property to determine whether the item is currently selected.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text caption for the panel item.
member.value: The text of the item. The default value is empty string.
member.example:
This example demonstrates how to set the text of the item using the Text property.
<radP:RadPanelbar ID="RadPanelbar1" runat="server">
<Items>
<radP:RadPanelItem Text="News" />
<radP:RadPanelItem Text="News" />
</Items>
</radP:RadPanelbar>
member.remarks: Use the Text property to specify the text to display for the item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.NavigateUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL to link to when the item is clicked.
member.value: The URL to link to when the item is clicked. The default value is empty string.
member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to use the NavigateUrl property
<telerik:RadPanelBar id="RadPanelBar1" runat="server">
<Items>
<telerik:RadPanelItem Text="News" NavigateUrl="~/News.aspx" />
<telerik:RadPanelItem Text="External URL" NavigateUrl="http://www.example.com" />
</Items>
</telerik:RadPanelBar>
member.remarks: Use the NavigateUrl property to specify the URL to link to when the item is clicked. Use "~" (tilde) in front of an URL within the same ASP.NET application. When specifying external URL do not forget the protocol (e.g. "http://").

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the target window or frame to display the Web page content linked to when the panel item is clicked.
member.value:
The target window or frame to load the Web page linked to when the Item is selected. Values must begin with a letter in the range of a through z (case insensitive), except for the following special values, which begin with an underscore:
_blank Renders the content in a new window without frames.
_parent Renders the content in the immediate frameset parent.
_self Renders the content in the frame with focus.
_top Renders the content in the full window without frames.
The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the Target property to specify the frame or window that displays the Web page linked to when the panel item is clicked. The Web page is specified by setting the NavigateUrl property.
If this property is not set, the Web page specified by the NavigateUrl property is loaded in the current window.

example.para: The following example demonstrates how to use the Target property

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the panel item.
member.value: The value associated with the item. The default value is empty string.

remarks.para: Use the Value property to specify or determine the value associated with the item.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.DataItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the data item represented by the item.
member.value: An object representing the data item to which the Item is bound to. The DataItem property will always return null when accessed outside of ItemDataBound event handler.
member.remarks: This property is applicable only during data binding. Use it along with the ItemDataBound event to perform additional mapping of fields from the data item to RadPanelItem properties.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItem.ItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the item.

value.para: A ITemplate implemented object that contains the template for displaying the item. The default value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates that this property is not set.
To specify common display for all panel items use the ItemTemplate property of the RadPanelbar class.

example.para: The following template demonstrates how to add a Calendar control in certain panel item.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItemCollection
member.summary: A collection of RadPanelItem objects in a RadPanelBar control.
member.remarks:
The RadPanelItemCollection class represents a collection of RadPanelItem objects.
Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single RadPanelItem from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of panel items in the collection.
Use the Add method to add items in the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove items from the collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.UI.RadPanelItemCollection.#ctor(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RadPanelItemCollection class.
member.param: The owner of the collection.

member.summary: Appends the specified RadPanelItem object to the end of the current RadPanelItemCollection.
member.param: The RadPanelItem to append to the end of the current RadPanelItemCollection.

member.summary: Appends the specified array of RadPanelItem objects to the end of the current RadPanelItemCollection.
member.param: The array of RadPanelItem o append to the end of the current RadPanelItemCollection.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell
member.summary: Telerik RadSpell

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.TagKey
member.summary: Gets the value that corresponds to this Web server control. This property is used primarily by control developers.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.HandlerUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for the spell dialog handler
member.value: the relative path for the spell dialog handler

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.DialogsCssFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of a CSS file, that will be added in the dialog window. If you need to include more than one file, use the CSS @import url(); rule to add the other files from the first. This property is needed if you are using a custom skin. It allows you to include your custom skin CSS in the dialogs, which are separate from the main page.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.DialogsScriptFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of a JavaScript file, that will be added in the dialog window. If you need to include more than one file, you will need to combine the scripts into one first. This property is needed if want to override some of the default functionality without loading the dialog from an external ascx file.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.AdditionalQueryString
member.summary: Gets or sets an additional querystring appended to the dialog URL.
member.value: A String, appended to the dialog URL

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.AllowAddCustom
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the spell will allow adding custom words.
member.value: The default is true

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.AjaxUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL which the AJAX call will be made to. Check the help for more information.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.ButtonText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the button that will start the spellcheck. This property is localizable.
member.value: The default is Spell Check

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.ButtonType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the button that will start the spellcheck.
member.value: The default is PushButton

remarks.para: Values allowed: PushButton/LinkButton/ImageButton/ None.
Setting the value to None will not render a button. The only way to start a spellcheck will be through the client-side API.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.ClientTextSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the class of the client side text source object.
member.value: A string containing the name of the JavaScript class. The default is HtmlElementTextSource -- a built in implementation that obtains the source from a HTML element.
member.remarks: The text source is a JavaScript object. It has to provide two methods: GetText() and SetText(newValue).

example.code:
<script type="text/javascript">
             function DifferentControlsSource()
             {
                 this.GetText = function()
                 {
                     return document.getElementById('before').value;
                 }
            
                 this.SetText = function(newValue)
                 {
                     document.getElementById('after').value = newValue;
                 }
             }
             </script>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.ControlToCheck
member.summary: The ID of the control to check.
member.remarks: The ID can be both a server-side ID, or a client-side ID. RadSpell will find the appropriate server control and use its ClientID to attach to it.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.ControlsToCheck
member.summary: An array of IDs of the control to check.
member.remarks: The IDs can be server-side or client-side. RadSpell will find the appropriate server control and use its ClientID to attach to it. Note that you cannot mix server and client IDs in this list - use only one kind.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.CustomDictionarySourceTypeName
member.summary: Gets or sets the fully qualified type name that will be used to store and read the custom dictionary.
member.remarks: The type name must be fully qualified if the type is in a GAC-deployed assembly. The type must implement the ICustomDictionarySource interface.

example.code: spell1.CustomDictionarySourceTypeName = "RadSpellExtensions.CustomDictionarySource, RadSpellExtensions, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b5e57ccb698eab8e";
spell1.CustomDictionarySourceTypeName = "RadSpellExtensions.CustomDictionarySource, RadSpellExtensions, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b5e57ccb698eab8e"

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.CustomDictionarySuffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the suffix for the custom dictionary files.
member.value: The default is -Custom
member.remarks: The filenames are formed with the following scheme: Language + CustomDictionarySuffix + ".txt". Different suffixes can be used to create different custom dictionaries for different users.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.DialogTypeName
member.summary: Gets or sets the assembly qualified name of the SpellDialog type.
member.value: The default is string.Empty

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.DialogVirtualPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual path of the UserControl that represents the SpellDialog.
member.value: The default is string.Empty

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.DictionaryLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the dictionary language used for spellchecking.
member.value: The default is en-US
member.remarks: The language name is used to find a corresponding dictionary file. Spellchecking in en-US will work only if a file en-US.TDF can be found inside the folder pointed to by DictionaryPath.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.DictionaryPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path for the dictionary files.
member.value: The default is ~/RadControls/Spell/TDF/
member.remarks: This is the path that contains the TDF files, and the custom dictionary TXT files.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.EditDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets a the edit distance. If you increase the value, the checking speed decreases but more suggestions are presented. Applicable only in EditDistance mode.
member.value: The default is 1
member.remarks: This property takes effect only if the SpellCheckProvider property is set to EditDistanceProvider.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.FragmentIgnoreOptions
member.summary: Configures the spellchecker engine, so that it knows whether to skip URL's, email addresses, and filenames and not flag them as erros.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.IsClientID
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether whether the ControlToCheck property provides a client element ID or a server side control ID.
member.value: The default is false.
member.remarks: When true RadSpell will look for the server-side control and get its ClientID. When false the ControlToCheck property will be interpreted as a client-side ID and will be used to attach to the target control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the localization language for the user interface.
member.value: The localization language for the user interface. The default value is en-US.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.SpellChecked
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the target control has been spellchecked.

remarks.para: Spellchecking the entire text by the client would set the property to true on postback.
The property is used by the SpellCheckValidator class. You can set it on the client side with RadSpell's SetSpellChecked(false) on various events, say a TEXTAREA's OnChange.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.SpellCheckProviderTypeName
member.summary: Allows the use of a custom spell checking provider. It must implement the ISpellCheckProvider interface.
member.value: The default is PhoneticProvider

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.SpellCheckProvider
member.summary: Specifies the spellchecking algorithm which will be used by RadSpell.
member.value: The default is PhoneticProvider

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.SupportedLanguages
member.summary: Gets or sets the supported languages.
member.remarks: The supported languages will be displayed in a drop-down list, and the user can select the language for spellchecking.
member.value: A string array containing the codes and names of the languages (code, name, code, name...)

example.code: <radS:RadSpell ID="spell1" Runat="server" ControlToCheck="textBox1" SupportedLanguages="en-US,English,fr-FR,French"> </radS:RadSpell>

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.WordIgnoreOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the value used to configure the spellchecker engine to ignore words containing: UPPERCASE, some CaPitaL letters, numbers; or to ignore repeated words (very very)

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.OnClientLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side function that will be called when the spell control is initialized on the page.
member.remarks: The function should accept two parameters: sender (the spell client object) and arguments.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.OnClientCheckStarted
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side function that will be called when the spell check starts.
member.remarks: The function should accept two parameters: sender (the spell client object) and arguments.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.OnClientCheckFinished
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the client-side function that will be called when the spell check is finished.
member.remarks: The function should accept two parameters: sender (the spell client object) and arguments.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.OnClientCheckCancelled
member.summary: Specifies the name of the client-side function that will be called when the user cancels the spell check.
member.remarks: The function should accept two parameters: sender (the spell client object) and arguments.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.OnClientDialogClosed
member.summary: Specifies the name of the client-side function that will be called before the spell check dialog closes.
member.remarks: The function should accept two parameters: sender (the dialog opener client object) and arguments.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.Skin
member.summary: Gets or sets the skin name for the control user interface.
member.value: A string containing the skin name for the control user interface. The default is string.Empty.

remarks.para: If this property is not set, the control will render using the skin named "Default". If EnableEmbeddedSkins is set to false, the control will not render skin.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.EnableAjaxSkinRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets the value, indicating whether to render the skin CSS files during Ajax requests

remarks.para: If EnableAjaxSkinRendering is set to false you will have to register the needed control base CSS file by hand when adding/showing the control with Ajax.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.EnableEmbeddedScripts
member.summary: Gets or sets the value, indicating whether to render links to the embedded client scripts or not.

remarks.para: If EnableEmbeddedScripts is set to false you will have to register the needed script files by hand.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.EnableEmbeddedSkins
member.summary: Gets or sets the value, indicating whether to render links to the embedded skins or not.

remarks.para: If EnableEmbeddedSkins is set to false you will have to register the needed CSS files by hand.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.RadSpell.EnableEmbeddedBaseStylesheet
member.summary: Gets or sets the value, indicating whether to render the link to the embedded base stylesheet of the control or not.

remarks.para: If EnableEmbeddedBaseStylesheet is set to false you will have to register the needed control base CSS file by hand.
