member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.SpellCheckValidator
member.summary: SpellCheckValidator validates a form based on a RadSpell control. It can be used to enforce spellchecking before form submission. The ControlToValidate must be set to the ID of a RadSpell control. The RadSpell control should be separately set up with a control to check and other options.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarButtonCollection
member.summary: A collection of RadToolBarButton objects in RadToolBarDropDown and RadToolBarSplitButton.

remarks.para: The RadToolBarButtonCollection class represents a collection of RadToolBarButton objects. The RadToolBarButton objects in turn represent buttons within a RadToolBarDropDown or a RadToolBarSplitButton.

list.item: Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single RadToolBarButton from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of buttons in the collection.
Use the Add method to add buttons to the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove buttons from the collection.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadToolBarItemCollection
member.summary: A collection of RadToolBarItem objects in a RadToolBar control.

remarks.para: The RadToolBarItemCollection class represents a collection of RadToolBarItem objects. The RadToolBarItem objects in turn represent items (buttons, dropdowns or split buttons) within a RadToolBar control.

list.item: Use the indexer to programmatically retrieve a single RadToolBarItem from the collection, using array notation.
Use the Count property to determine the total number of toolbar items in the collection.
Use the Add method to add toolbar items to the collection.
Use the Remove method to remove toolbar items from the collection.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeViewContextMenu
member.summary: A context menu control used with the control.

remarks.para: The RadTreeViewContextMenu object is used to assign context menus to nodes. Use the property to add context menus for a object.
Use the property to assign specific context menu to a given .

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to add context menus declaratively
<telerik:RadTreeView ID="RadTreeView1" runat="server"> <ContextMenus> <telerik:RadTreeViewContextMenu ID="ContextMenu1"> <Items> <telerik:RadMenuItem Text="Menu1Item1"></telerik:RadMenuItem> <telerik:RadMenuItem Text="Menu1Item2"></telerik:RadMenuItem> </Items> </telerik:RadTreeViewContextMenu> <telerik:RadTreeViewContextMenu Skin="Outlook" ID="ContextMenu2"> <Items> <telerik:RadMenuItem Text="Menu2Item1"></telerik:RadMenuItem> <telerik:RadMenuItem Text="Menu2Item2"></telerik:RadMenuItem> </Items> </telerik:RadTreeViewContextMenu> </ContextMenus> <Nodes> <telerik:RadTreeNode Text="Node1" ContextMenuID="ContextMenu2"> <Nodes> <telerik:RadTreeNode Text="Node11" ContextMenuID="ContextMenu2"></telerik:RadTreeNode> <telerik:RadTreeNode Text="Node12" ContextMenuID="ContextMenu2"></telerik:RadTreeNode> </Nodes> </telerik:RadTreeNode> <telerik:RadTreeNode Text="Node2" ContextMenuID="ContextMenu2"> <Nodes> <telerik:RadTreeNode Text="Node21" ContextMenuID="ContextMenu2"></telerik:RadTreeNode> <telerik:RadTreeNode Text="Node22" ContextMenuID="ContextMenu2"></telerik:RadTreeNode> </Nodes> </telerik:RadTreeNode> </Nodes> </telerik:RadTreeView>

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeViewContextMenuEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that handles the ContextMenuItemClick event of a RadTreeView control.
member.param: The source of the event.
A RadTreeViewContextMenuEventArgs that contains the event data.

remarks.para: The ContextMenuItemClick event is raised when an item in the RadTreeViewContextMenu of the RadTreeView control is clicked.
A click on a RadTreeViewContextMenu item of the RadTreeView makes a postback only if an event handler is attached to the ContextMenuItemClick event.

member.example:
The following example demonstrates how to display information about the clicked item in the RadTreeViewContextMenu shown after a right-click on a RadTreeNode. <%@ Page Language="C#" AutoEventWireup="true" %> <%@ Register TagPrefix="Telerik" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" %>

Click on a context menu item to see the information for it.
<%@ Page Language="VB" AutoEventWireup="true" %> <%@ Register TagPrefix="Telerik" Namespace="Telerik.Web.UI" Assembly="Telerik.Web.UI" %>

Click on a context menu item to see the information for it.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeNodeExpandMode
member.summary: This enumeration controls the expand behaviour of the nodes.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeNodeExpandMode.ClientSide
member.summary: The default behaviour - all nodes are loaded in the intial request and expand is performed on the client, without server interaction

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeNodeExpandMode.ServerSide
member.summary: Forces firing of the NodeExpand event - a postback occurs and developers can populate the node with its children in server side event handler

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeNodeExpandMode.ServerSideCallBack
member.summary: Forces firing of the NodeExpand event asyncronously from the client without postback - the NodeExpand event fires and child nodes added to the node collection are automatically transferred to the client without postback.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeNodeExpandMode.WebService
member.summary: The child nodes are loaded from the web service specified by the RadTreeView.WebServicePath and RadTreeView.WebServiceMethod properties.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition
member.summary: Specifies where the loading message is shown when Client-side load on demand is used.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.BeforeNodeText
member.summary: If the node text is "Some Text", the text is changed to "(loading ...) Some Text" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.AfterNodeText
member.summary: If the node text is "Some Text", the text is changed to "Some Text (loading ...)" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.BelowNodeText
member.summary: The text is not changed and (loading ...)" when child nodes are being loaded (Assuming the LoadingMessage property has been set to "(loading...)";

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.TreeViewLoadingStatusPosition.None
member.summary: No loading text is displayed at all.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeViewDropPosition.Above
member.summary: The source node(s) is dropped above (before) the destination node.

member.name: F:Telerik.Web.UI.RadTreeViewDropPosition.Below
member.summary: The source node(s) is dropped below (after) the destination node.

summary.para: Represents the method that will handle the custom validation event.

member.param: The RadUpload instance which fired the event.
A ValidateFileEventArgs that contain the event data.

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.UI.Upload.ValidateFileEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the ValidatingFile event of the RadUpload control.

remarks.para: A ValidatingFileEventArgs is passed to the ValidatingFile event handler to provide event data to the handler. The ValidatingFile event event is raised when validation is performed on the server. This allows you to perform a custom server-side validation routine on a file of a RadUpload control.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.Upload.ValidateFileEventArgs.IsValid
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the value specified by UploadedFile property passed validation.
member.value: true to indicate that the value specified by the UploadedFile property passed validation; otherwise, false

remarks.para: Once your validation routine finishes, use the IsValid property to indicate whether the value specified by the UploadedFile property passed validation. This value determines whether the file from the RadUpload control passed validation.

member.name: P:Telerik.Web.UI.Upload.ValidateFileEventArgs.SkipInternalValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the internal validation should continue validating the file specified by the UploadedFile property.
member.value: false to indicate that the internal validation should validate the file specified by the UploadedFile property; otherwise, true
member.remarks: Once your validation routine finishes, use the SkipInternalValidation property to skip the internal validation provided by the RadUpload control.
